description:
It was my first time here and boy if I had brought more money I wouldve bought me a second sandwich. The Romas Club was that good! The dutch crunch bread by itself is just godly. Inside is spacious, enough seats to go around, very clean, and they play good music for you to listen to while you eat your meal. 2 stars for the Food, 2 stars for Service. Everything was great. Definitely will be back for another 

Update: Here again for another meal. +1 star
author: Calvin G.

description:
Lou's is a good place to go for a good sandwich,   


Only thing is.......

expensive and needs twice as much meat even if it is boarhead
author: Rod D.

description:
Update one year later! Still one of my favorite Sandwich shops. Even one year later, my parents still love the roast beef sandwich, and I still love the delicious veggie-licious sandwich on Dutch crunch. Happy to support a small local business!

Solid sandwich shop with the best Dutch crunch. I ordered a roast beef mushroom sandwich for my dad. He absolutely loved it, especially with all the meat and flavors, and he's pretty difficult to please. I ordered a veggie delish on Dutch crunch and also loved all the packed veggies (avocado and roasted red peppers!!!) and special sauce, which paired well with the crunchiness of the bread. Portions are huge, so you can save the other half for dinner or lunch the next day.
author: Joanne K.

description: What a gem of a sandwich shop! Next time you are craving a sold sandwich be sure and ditch Subway or Ike's to come here. There are a variety of sandwiches and  salads to choose from that everyone is sure to leave satisfied. There food is priced competitively and fairly. They also do a stamp card here so you can easily earn a free sandwich if you come here enough.
author: Franchesca B.

description:
I ordered my sandwich through eat 24. I thought the pick up wait time was a bit long, 30-40 mins but at any rate, I still ordered. 

I actually stopped by to order at the Geary location. However the line was long. I saw a "eat 24 / pick up" sign at their counter. I figured, why not just order online instead of waiting in their long line. It turns out I actually placed the order at their Taraval location & that their Geary location doesn't even accept orders online via Eat 24. Ok, whatever.

I called the Taraval location to tell them I'll be 30 mins late picking up my order since I thought I had placed my order at the Geary location. 

I picked up my sandwich. It wasn't crazy busy in there but by the time I picked up my sandwich, it was 2:45 PM (super late lunch). The sandwich guy thanked me for letting them know about the mix up. The sandwich was seriously good though. I ordered a Roma Club. The Dutch crunch bread was fresh & soft. I liked the jalapeño spread too.
author: Ruby V.

description:
I love their Turkey Cranberry sandwiches!!
I used to always get it on a 9-grain roll, but I've switched to sliced wheat, and OMG. I ordered it twice this week lol. First time was by phone, second time was thru yelp. I arrived in 15-20 mins and both times the sandwiches were bagged and ready for me. I always eat half and save the other half for another time. After a quick toast in the toaster oven, it is still so bomb. Thank you Lous, for making my meals so tasty!
author: Jen H.

description:
Sandwiches are super big and delicious/flavorful. If I'm craving a sandwich, this is the first place I would think of. I don't know what they put in that Lou's special sauce, but it is HELLA good. 

They have a kettle dill pickled chips flavor too. So good!!!

Love this place so much!
author: Bonnie T.

description:
Best sandwich shop hands down.

Beats all the popular SF sandwich shops in my opinion. My usual is the turkey cranberry. The sweet and savory is too good to pass up.

Staff is always friendly and the sandwiches are always perfect.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Lou's Cafe is a mini sandwich place that makes impeccable sandwiches. This sandwich shop is hands down of one of the best in the city! I highly recommended the Risky Business sandwich ! 5/5
The Risky Business comes with crab meat, pastrami  brisket cooked to perfection, topped off with jalapeño rings, avocado, lettuce and tomato. Its served with a Dutch cheese bread that is to die for!! If you love sushi and love sandwiches, you'll be in heaven if you tried this!!
Seating is limited, so getting it togo and taking it to the park is a nice way to go!
author: Chris+Lilly 1.

description:
AMAAZING sandwiches, great service! 

This cute little mom& pop sandwich shop is such a delight and a must whenever I'm in Daly City. They have the bessst Dutch crunch bread and all meets and ingredients they use in their sandwiches are always fresh! The Lou's special sauce and jalapeño spread are also a MUST. The special sauce is an orange garlic-aioli sauce and when paired with the jalapeño sauce, its drop dead delishhh. I always get the make your own sandwich option ($8.95) with DUTCH CRUNCH (obvi), turkey/chicken breast/pastrami with all the goodie toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion). Alll this for under $9, UM YES. My bf loves the RB mushroom, which is packed with meat and very flavorful

Employees are so nice and attentive! I always feel so welcome when I come here (:
author: Lilly N.

description:
The place to go to get a decent sandwich.

Crab melt / Risky business / Ultimate club are my favorite ones in order. 
I usually get no pickles/tomatoes/onions.

The missing star is for their inconsistency of the amount of crab they put in the sandwich. Sometimes it's a decent amount, sometimes it's a thin layer. I guess it really depends when you go and who makes it.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Seeing as the SF zoo has a comically bad set of food choices (especially given its location in SF), I ordered sandwiches and picked them up on my way home. Solid all around. Bread, meat, toppings and assembly were all what I wanted. This place just earned a repeat visit and I suggest you give it a try too if you're in the area.
author: Darin E.

description:
If this is your first time at Lou's and can't decide which amazing sandwich to get, just order the Hot Pastrami - get it the way it is and load it with whatever extra toppings you want. 

That Dutch Crunch bread, pastrami and mayo jalapeno spread (Lou's special spread) is going to be worth every gram on your macronutrient counter. 

Now armed with a sandwich stamp card (purchase 9 sandwiches, and the 10th one is free), I'm officially a Lou's sandwich phene.
author: Janice K.

description: Got the Ami-Cado and it was delicious. I like the ingredients and the flavor. Will try the other different sandwiches in the future.
author: Juan V.

description:
I never knew a sandwich could be so delicious.
Apparently I've passed by this place many times before but never knew it was even there. But once I tried it, I couldn't stop. My favorite is the Ami-cado. The bread is soft and toasted. The meats are fresh and flavorful. The sauces are savory and spicy but just the right amount of spicy, not too much. The café itself is clean and bright. Haven't really tried anything else there but once you've found the one, why go for other options. But I'm sure everything there is great. You can't go wrong with any of their options! Tip: get a stamp card!
author: Lily F.

description:
I love Lou's! How have I not written a review yet??? This is a pretty regular stop for me when I want something reliable and yummy prior to adventures in the city. They have a creative sandwich board where you can opt for either their set menu or a build your own. My go to is the Veggie-which is loaded with sprouts, tomatoes, lettuce, roasted red peppers, avocado and Swiss cheese (I sometimes leave the cheese off.) It comes on a multi grain roll and when toasted is sheer perfection! Every visit has yielded fresh ingredients, fairly quick service and a nice clean and spacious seating area.
The Lou's sauce is not to be skipped-that adds a not to spicey but just enough flavor of a kick. They're also very accommodating with changing ingredients on the set menu items-once in a while I sub in Dutch Crunch. Don't forget to ask for your stamp card-10 stamps and then you get a free sandwich. 
There is metered street parking on Taraval but if you drive up the hill a few blocks there is ample free street parking as well. I've been to their Geary location as well but while the food is just as good, there is less parking and seating. Great local deli and one of my go-to lunch spots. I even brought out of town guests who LOVED it here.
author: Jennifer N.

description: The hot pastrami sandwich (substitute wheat bread), was UNREAL. it has a delicious jalapeño spread on it. YUUUUM.
author: Russell J.

description:
Called 8 times over about 45 mins to try and order some sandwiches. Phone was busy most of that time, but when they did finally answer the lady asked me to hold and just sat the phone down for over 5 minutes. 

Never got my amicados! :(

I'm assuming this lady just doesn't want to be bothered with phone orders? Pretty bad way to treat a long time customer...
author: Bernie M.

description:
Wow, how did I not know about this place....I went to high school right up on 24th Avenue and I never came to visit this place till recently. Parking is all streets or in the neighborhood. My friend and I went to workout and we were pretty hungry so we decided to check out Lou's Cafe. This place reminds me of the sandwich spot in Sacramento where they have a bunch of sandwiches on the chalk wall and they have all their signature sandwiches. My friend and I didn't want to get too full since it was close to dinner time so we decided to split the pesto chicken sandwich. Honestly, if it wasn't close to dinner, I would've probably ate that whole sandwich in a minute but luckily we shared. The pesto chicken was definitely a sandwich you can't go wrong with. Our order came out pretty quick too which was nice. There was barely any customers so that was good. The chicken was super flavorful and juicy. The pesto definitely is an order that you can never go wrong with. 

Overall, service was great and the food was great. I can't wait to try other things on the menu next time I'm in the area! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
GREAT PLACE AND ORDER THROUGH THE APP.

We've been here several times and the quality is always consistent. At Lou's, the Hot Pastrami on Dutch crunch bread is always a winner. This is the first time I ordered and prepaid through the app.  I ordered, found a place to park and picked it up. It saved me a lot of time trying to get through the hoards of kids during lunch time.  Last time, ordered the same sandwich before catching a flight and enjoyed it in the air. Sure did get a lot of stares during drink service!
author: Stefan L.

description: Honestly this place is bomb, the food is really great and fresh! There was a line but who cares i knew that meant it was worth waiting for! If you love sandwiches definitely go here, prices aren't too bad and the food is phenomenal. I will be coming back:)
author: Claire L.

description:
Excellent sandwich. Was in the mood for a standard roast beef but there are tons of specialty sandwich options to choose from. Order taking was quick and the sandwich was out in minutes. 

Place is very clean to.
author: Richard C.

description:
My manager and I were getting out of a meeting on 10/25 around 11:00 AM and needed some breakfast, I did what I usually do when in an unfamiliar area and used yelp to find a place. 

I saw the 4 1/2 stars and decided this place would get a try. I took a star off due to not having an AC or not working the day I went here. It was a really hot day and I rushed to eat my food to get back in the AC in my car. 

The place is spacious with enough seating area, clean, and the staff is attentive. They have a pretty extensive menu varying from breakfast, sandwiches, fountain drinks and bottle drinks. We had breakfast and I must say the food is extremely good. I had an omelette that came in a sandwich with hash browns. My boss said his sandwich was really good as well. 

I recommend this place for breakfast and will visit again when in the area.
author: Andre M.

description: We needed a quick bite to eat and found this killer sandwich shop. I got the Risky Business: pastrami brisket, crab, bacon, avocado and pepper jack cheese on a Dutch-crunch roll. It was sooo good. My husband got the Roma's Club: turkey, bacon, avocado, Swiss, pesto aioli on a Dutch crunch roll. It was a toss up as to who had the better sandwich!
author: Ali R.

description:
Local gems are the greatest, wouldn't you say? It's nice to have options but when a local place really hits the spot, you don't really need to go anywhere else. 

Lou's cafe is right in taraval street in Sunset. When you walk in the left half is a huge menu display with the workers freshly making your sandwiches. The right are refrigerators and a seating area. It's simple, but an extensive menu so there's something for everyone. 

I got the original breakfast sandwich and the corned beef hash Sammie. The first one gives you a choice of ham or bacon (get both) for the same price. Along with egg, American cheese, hash browns and Lou's special sauce. The SammiE comes with corned beef, cheddar cheese, egg, hash browns and Lou's special sauce. Both were great in texture, portion, taste and price. If I'm in the area I'd be back!
author: Lilian N.

description:
Aaammmmaaaaazzziiinnngggggg sandwiches!
I think the salads are a bit of a rip off because they're on iceburg lettuce (basically water) and they could definitely throw more veggies on them for $9, but the sandwiches are delicious and the wait time is reasonable considering the lunch rush they get!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
3.5 stars. 

I came here after a gym session and wanted something quick and easy. I ordered the asian chicken salad. I asked for no wonton strips. When I got it, I was kind of disappointed. The lettuce that they used was kind of old. Well it just wasn't the freshest. It had a good amount of mandarin oranges. The chicken pieces are the grilled kind from Cost Co. I still like it and ate it. It's a big portion. I asked for the dressing on the side; it was more than enough. 

I think that I would like to come again but for the sandwich instead. I'm sure it would be a better option for me. Until next time!
author: Tina Y.

description: Best sandwiches I've had. I'll drive from the other side of the city for lunch here. I think this place is great. Always clean, always friendly staff, and always of course super delicious food.
author: Alex T.

description: Too bad they closed the Geary location. If they haven't it's too bad that location isn't available for delivery by Postmates etc. . Previous sandwiches were excellent as expected. Today's sandwiches, delivered from the Taraval location sucked comparatively. If this is a new thing I'll never be ordering another Lou's Cafe sandwich again. Yeah it was exactly what I ordered on paper, but no style or expertise which is what people come to expect from Lou's, a properly made sandwich with an eye towards personal enjoyment. It's what we all look for, that mark of an expert wherein the person making your food also would enjoy eating it themselves. This WAS NOT THE CASE TODAY!
author: Gregory F.

description: Their original breakfast sammy is by far the best in San Francisco! The ciabatta is crisped to perfection and they go above and beyond by putting hash browns IN the sandwich. Anything you get from here will be delicious but don't forget to get the stamp card to earn a free sandwich for when you come back
author: Jordan J.

description:
SO GOOD.

I wish i came here sooner!

i got the Risky business....risky im sure since its hot pastrami, crab meat, avocado, pepper jack cheese and their special sauce. CRAZY combination but you know what's even CRAZIER that the flavors are balanced and very flavorful.

the bread is so soft but still have a crunch on top. NOT too thick too! 

9.32 with tax and the sandwich is huge!

will definitely come back again!
author: Carol Y.

description: Lou's has the best sandwiches in town. I know - I grew up here. You can specify every topping you want, including the amount of meat, which is available in three quantities (normal, extra, and double). That degree of specificity ensures that you get exactly what you want. The meats are high quality and the veggies are fresh - I can't see any way to improve on these sandwiches. Lou is killing it.
author: David B.

description: Amazing. Ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich with everything except tomatoes. I also got a side of ranch. It was very flavorful and had a good amount of spice. It would be good with avocado added too. Definitely recommend this sandwich.
author: Emma H.

description: I was disappointed. Ordered the Asian chicken salad. I should have listened to my instinct. I was expecting some sesame flavored-soy- cilantro magic. I wanted to give it a chance. But alas, disappointment. The miso dressing wasn't doing it. Staff were otherwise friendly. Restaurant was clean. May come back for a second try.
author: Michaela C.

description: Great sandwiches, great price. Local neighborhood spot, called in, quick to answer- accurate quote time. One big thing about sandwich places for me is I like avocado in my sammys, but if it's soggy or brown, I passup-- this place, fresher than picking and cutting it my damn self.
author: Travis W.

description:
I've been coming to Lous since high school but recently tried the Taraval location for the first time. 

I've always appreciated the extensive menu though some of the items sound very similar. Glad to find out that the sandwiches taste just like they used to and the Dutch crunch bread is still on point. The portions are good and they don't skimp on the fillings. It's a decent meal if you're in the area, on the go, or craving an above average deli sandwich
author: Carissa G.

description: So I do my laundry across the street and came here to eat while waiting for my clothes to get clean. I had the RB mushroom sandwich, and let me tell you, so freaking delicious!!! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu
author: Knar K.

description: Im in love with this place. The ppl there are very courteous. And the food delicious. I go almost every work day!
author: Saul A.

description:
This place is great! Excellent sandwiches, even better service.
And the free sandwich (or salad!!) punch card is a total deal.
Thanks guys!
author: Rahna B.

description:
An absolute must try if you are in the area and love sandwiches. A friend brought me here as it is one of the places she visits when she is home in SF. From the street this place looks like a small shop but do not let the sign outside fool you this place is pretty spacious and more of a modern touch inside. They have a large variety of sandwiches on their menu and plenty of flexibility with substituting any options. 
As a first timer I went with something already on the menu a Hot Pastrami and my friend ordered a Roma (turkey bacon avocado pesto and the works). We shared sandwiches so we could both taste because sandwiches are our all time favorite food, and it was Delicious! They toast the bread (DUTCH CRUNCH-can't go wrong with Dutch crunch, sold me on this establishment). 
Everything was superb from the service to sandwich, pricing for the portion was more than appropriate!
author: Sabrina V.

description: Favorite sandwich place in San Francisco! Used to frequent the Geary location many moons ago. Returned to this location after not having a Lous sandwich in 5+ years (I left SF) and the owner remembered my order! Jalapeño spread is also delicious and they make sure they put the right amount of garnishes on every sandwich so it's balanced. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Alison B.

description: Really tasty sandwich, $11 and some change for a crab melt and a Diet Coke, not too pricey. The sandwich comes with Jalepeño sauce, I asked for half and it was perfect. Would have given 5 stars but I reserve 5 stars for being blown away, and this was yummy but a smudge on the small side. I've had deli sandwiches that were bigger for that price. If ur in the neighborhood and hungry it's a good place to stop.
author: Rosalinda R.

description: So I was stuck between a few items on their menu and I went with their Tortilla Salad.  I am used to tortilla salads coming with a mexican/ranch type of sauce, but on their menu they paired it with thousand island.  Talk about DELICIOUS!! The were very generous on the portion of avocado, and it was perfectly ripe.  This salad was amazing and I would go back just to get it again, but next time I'm trying the pesto chicken sandwich!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: Risky Business = the best sandwich I've had in my LIFE. Wanna come here every day  ride or die.
author: Avery A.

description:
I ordered the Risky Bizness and a cup of New England clam chowder. The risky bizness is made of brisket, avocado, crab salad, cheese, and some bacon. The portion was huge! I would definitely consider sharing a sandwich with another person. I had it in the morning and only ate half of it. I was almost knocked out after finishing half.

The clam chowder was yummy too! It came with bread that was seasoned with cheese and some other stuff. It was delicious!! If I was from the area, I would definitely come back to explore the rest of their menu. Staff was nice and quick as well.

Heads up! Each sandwich already includes certain ingredients such as tomatoes, jalapeños, onions. It is listed on a piece of paper at the cashier. I did not notice until after my order, but thankfully it didn't matter much to me.
author: Shirley G.

description: We regularly get sandwiches in Taraval location, and always a great job - very tasty.
author: Julia A.

description: Decided to try this place out after seeing the reviews of 4 stars +. It was okay for me. The sandwiches was small and the meat was even less. I'll pass and find something else next time.
author: U L.

description: The Veggie-Licious sandwich is absolutely delicious with freshly grilled veggie and melted cheddar cheese between a lightly toast sweet roll.  I'm not aware of a better sandwich place than this shop in Sunset.
author: Patrick C.

description:
The first time I came here, I literally waited in line and ordered. I got the Risky Bizness since it seemed to be one of the popular sandwiches here. I can see why people do call in orders for here, the wait is cray cray (waited for 20-30 minutes). The wait seemed worth it when I opened my packed sandwich at home. The dutch crunch was delicious and held a texture that wasn't too hard or too soft. The combination of imitation crab salad/bacon/avocado/pastrami/special sauce was too perfect. 

If you do end up coming here, make sure to get a stamp card!
author: Erica K.

description: Love their risky business sandwich. So good! My boyfriend and I come here often. The staff here are amazing and friendly.
author: Priscilla D.

description:
Probably the best sandwich I have ever had. Yes, I said it. We had my daughter's soccer game just a few blocks away and were early. So, we dined in. 
Hubby got the Kickin RB, kids got grilled cheeses and I got the Risky Business; pastrami and crab melt with bacon, avacado, lettuce and tomato on Dutch crunch. Their bread was excellent- it didn't leave the roof of my mouth sore. The sauce, omg!!! It is to die for!!
All the workers there are super nice. This place is really clean too!
I am going to come back for sure to try their other sandwiches!!!
author: Mimie L.

description:
If it weren't for a strong recommendation from a colleague, I don't think I would've ever discovered this place.  The front is nondescript and subtle.  The inside isn't over the top fancy either but the alluring smells from the outside will definitely draw you in!
I ordered the Risky Business, sans pepperoncinis.  The combo of the pepperjack cheese and jalapeno spread provided a subtle kick to each bite, and enveloped my mouth in a warm hug.  The amount of pastrami brisket was perfectly balanced with the other parts, such as crab meat, avocado, etc.  
Lastly the soft inside and crunchy outside of the dutch crunch roll was the perfect balance.  
Parking isn't too bad during the weekday, not sure about the evenings or weekends.  
I am definitely coming back!
author: Serena L.

description:
Great neighborhood spot for a tasty sandwich. If you like pastrami, try the Risky Business. Sooo good! The clam chowder is also pretty tasty. 

Tip: call in your order or go a lil early. If you hit the lunch rush, there could be a lil bit of a line. Lol!
author: Helen W.

description:
Hubby raved about the sandwiches. Even better than Ike's Sandwiches and definitely better than Safeway he told me. So I got a pastrami on Dutch Crunch for under $9.  Hubby got another and we got Jr Yelper a chicken with bacon. I took a peak at Jr Yelpers sandwich and it is processed chicken meat. The kind you buy at the supermarket in packages. At least Safeway gives you a real chicken breast and slice that up onto your bread. 
Jr Yelper and I disagreed that the sandwiches taste better than Ike's but it is certainly $2 less. I didn't think there was enough pastrami meat in mine but the sandwich was good. You get tomatoes, lettuce, sauce, pickle and the bread was big.  
There are tables to eat and they have small bags of chips for $1.50.  I would be willing to try another sandwich next time but for the price, Safeway is a better bargain.
author: Ry T.

description: Ordered the Italian sandwich. Came on soft roll with mortadella, ham and salami. Lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles and the special jalapeño spread. The spread was pretty spicey but worth it. Overall, really good and not too pricey for SF sandwiches. Lines can get long but it's a great spot. Parking is tough.
author: Danielle H.

description: Excellent customer service the man who took my order over the phone was extremely nice and very patient with my order when I got there to pick up my order the girl who ring me up was super nice and friendly repeated my order and even gave me a stamp card. Never ate at this location but has their sandwich at their original location for the first time with my cuzzo Jane and it was so good I decided to come back today to try something new. I got a hot pastrami on Dutch crunch and RB cheddar also on Dutch crunch. I like this location it seem a lot bigger and both location are very clean with very helpful and friendly staff. I'll be back. Thx to my cuzzo Jane Nguyen for putting my on!
author: Michele T.

description: husband and I decided we want sandwiches for lunch today so we got a hot pastrami on Dutch for him and a risky business on Dutch for me - OMG the risky is to die for delicious - the portion was huge so we ended up splitting one and saving the pastrami for later
author: Mia C.

description: Ordered delivery the other day, being stuck at the house waiting for contractors. Quick delivery and great food, a winning combo!
author: Derek C.

description: Great sandwiches and salads at a good price  can't go wrong with the Turkey Cranberry or Ultimate Club
author: Phillip H.

description:
Very friendly. The location smells great!! The bathroom was clean and spacious.

The names of the food are all very punny and yummy!!
author: Selah D.

description:
Lou's, Lou's, Lou's, what have you done to me? Lou's Cafe has been a long time favorite of mine. I've been going to the Richmond District location on 14th and Geary for as long as I can remember when I lived there, but as of a year and a half ago, I moved to the Sunset District and was not able to go there as much. Now that there's a Lou's Cafe in the Sunset District, I find myself going often once again. What can I say, this place is addictive. May I even say some of the best sandwiches in the city are made here? I think so. Easily.

This spot has a very diverse menu. I'm talking 30+ sandwiches to chose from, and every single one is delicious. You really can't go wrong with any selection and could end up coming here for months and still not trying all that they have to offer. My personal favorite is the BBQ Chicken sandwich. While it may be a bit saucy and can get your hands sticky, it's well worth it. Another personal favorite is Roma's Club. That's the one I got on my last visit (see the picture I took). It's absolutely crisp, fresh and the flavor is top notch. Another thing that's so great about Lou's is the stamp cards they offer. By no means an original trend, but considering this place is already addictive, there's no doubt you'll eventually reach a free sandwich. 

Pro tip: NEVER turn down the jalapeño sauce. It's a gem and one of the best sauces I've ever had.
author: Alex B.

description: I was at a friend's place in San Francisco and saw Lou's Cafe around the corner. I went with to grab lunch there and was not disappointed. Being allergic to many foods, I had to request many changes to my sandwich. I was met with a warm attitude and even better, everything was prepared just as I had asked. I was impressed since it was lunch time and they were pretty busy. I will definitely be going to Lou's Cafe more often!
author: Bryan H.

description:
I highly recommend the risky business sandwich on dutch crunch roll. Get it toasted too! 

I came here on a saturday at 1pm and it was busy. The wait for a sandwich can be quite long when they are busy. The staff is pretty friendly and parking is easy

Ive been to the geary st one as well and i think these two are pretty consistent with one another in terms of quality
author: Kevin Z.

description:
With over twenty different sandwich styles to choose from, Lou's surely doesn't disappoint when it comes to balancing flavors and offering a great deal for portion size. Sandwiches are huge and filling, averaging $8 or $9.

So far, I've tried their Chicken Pesto, Ami-cado, and Risky Business. The Chicken Pesto has a nice and creamy pesto aioli that isn't too rich or heavy. There's just enough spread to moisten the soft and fluffy sweet roll without it becoming too soggy. Lou's Ami-cado (pastrami, salami, avocado, and cheese) is one of their most popular sandwiches, with smokey pastrami and salty salami meats balanced with the buttery and creamy fresh avocado. The Risky Business (pastrami brisket, imitation crab salad, bacon, avocado, pepperoncini, cheese) gets a little messy with all those ingredients, yet it's deliciously salty from the meats, creamy from the crab salad, and buttery from the avocado. If you're in for sandwich adventure, try the Risky Business.

Lou's jalapeño spread has a mild kick to it, but it's not too spicy and definitely doesn't linger. All sandwiches can be altered to your liking, ie: eliminating or adding extra ingredients, swapping one bread roll for another, etc.

The original Lou's is in the Inner Richmond, but I'm glad they opened a second location in Parkside. It makes a great addition to the heavily-residential neighborhood. Lou's is definitely one of my new go-to shop to satisfy my deli-meat style sandwich cravings.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Lou's is one of my favorite sandwich shops in the city! They have fresh quality ingredients, a killer secret sauce, and creative combinations that'll make your head spin. Their sammies and menu concept are similar in style to Ike's. 

Their new location has capitalized on all the uncontrollable downsides their sister shop on Geary has. I'm pretty sure I wasn't the only person who was annoyed by the cash register being literally feet from the door, creating an instant line and a road block for people trying to get out. The chips are also visible before you order, instead of hiding on the other side of the counter, and there is more parking, seating, and space at the Taraval location. Diggin' the cheerful orange walls too! 

I've never met a sandwich I didn't like here. Honestly, just order whatever strikes your fancy from their giant menu, and you won't be disappointed. But if you're still having trouble, here are some of my favorites: 

1) Risky Business 
2) Hot Pastrami 
3) Lou-Ben
4) Ami-Cado

The first time I was here, they forgot to switch my requested bread to dutch crunch, and the second time, they ran out of torpedo bread for my breakfast omelette sandwich, but their sandwiches are so yummy that all is forgiven. The staff are always super chill and friendly and they have punchcards if you're a frequent fatty sandwich eater. If it's a nice day, I highly recommend picking up a ginger beer along with your sandwich and enjoy it down at Ocean Beach!
author: Deanna Y.

description: Great family owned local sandwich spot. Quality ingredients & great service! I usually get the Veggie and add chicken. They only use Boars Head meat, very tasty! Get your sandwich with the works, it's the only way to go!
author: Kenny V.

description: More than your average sandwich shop because their creations are complex yet simple and delicious! Definitely try the Risky Business! The brisket is so tender and flavorful and the banana peppers and avocado work well in the combination. Their special sauce is also very good but the best kept secret has to be their soup bread! It's a thin piece of bread with melted cheese on top! I was blown away by how good it tasted.
author: Judy M.

description:
I snuck in a few minutes before closing and the staff were so friendly to make our sandwiches.  I've had the Geary location bookmarked for awhile, but glad to see that they've opened up in the Sunset.  

It was a hard choice since everything looks so good, but I went with the Hot & Sweet.  The hot & sweet comes with hot links, pineapple slices, cheese, teriyaki sauce, alongside the usual Lou's fixings (I omitted pickles and the jalapeno sauce).  He went with the chicken pesto.  The chicken pesto came with chicken breast slices, cheese, avocado, and pesto sauce (with the usual Lou's fixings, omitted pickles)  Both were listed on the menu as under different breads but we both love Dutch Crunch so we asked for it that way.  It only took a few minutes to make and they were hefty!

My sandwich was so messy, but so tasty!  Hot links weren't really spicy but plump and juicy.  The teriyaki and pineapple worked well with the Lou's sauce.  The dutch crunch was nice and chewy.  The quality in the sandwich is here.  His chicken pesto was great too; as the pesto wasn't too strong.  I liked the little subtleness of the jalapeno sauce.  

We still love Little Lucca's but Lou's Cafe is a great deli and affordable in the area (sammies under $8), so 5 stars for location, quality ingredients, affordable prices and tastiness!  Yes, I like Lou's way better than that SF now Bay Area sandwich king, Ike's!
author: Cat C.

description:
I wish I took a picture of the sandwiches but we couldn't help ourselves. The employees there are really nice, the shop is big and very clean. Their menu board is overwhelming but full of good ass food. Reviews on the subs...

Space Balls(Meatball Marinara) 9/10. My boyfriend got this sandwich, it was delicious. He didn't get the jalapeño spread which it still came out perfect and crunchy even with the soft roll it came with. I took one point off because I wish it my sub): 

Kickin RB 3/10 BUT this is only because I was told the horseradish sauce is slight, but it overpowered the sandwich!!!! I can taste strong wasabi taste  in every bite, which disappointed my taste buds. But if I didn't get the horseradish sauce I would've rated this 10/10!
author: Camille B.

description: I keep forgetting how close this Lous location is to my house because it used to be a liquor store awhile ago. All their sandwiches are really unique and their special Lou sauce and jalapeño spread is soooo good in their sandwiches. I always ask for extra jalapeño spread for more heat. Their veggielicious is so good for being a vegetarian sandwich and I finally got to try their most popular sandwich risky business, which has imitation crab salad and pastrami which is a very unique combo in a sandwich and it taste soo delicious! The place is super clean and spacious to done in but most people order take out.
author: Korina D.

description:
So happy Lou's is in the Sunset now.  Geary is just too far when one is feeling lazy.

Chicken Pesto is my usual.  Plenty of chicken breast slices, avocado, tomato, pesto sauce, and of course on a Dutch Crunch makes everything tasty and crunchy.  I decided to get a Loquito one time, and while it's just as good, I don't recommend saving it for the next day.  The tortilla chips gets soggy.

Big selection of sandwich combinations, and you can make your own if nothing sounds good.  A stamp card is available, so make sure to get one.
author: Karen L.

description:
Stumbled onto this local place when we were heading over to Ocean Beach from my niece's place.  And, I am glad my daughter was starving which necessitated the search.  

Their sandwich creations read very tasty and intriguing.  However, we ordered a basic pastrami sandwich with provolone and chili.  Both were delicious and sizable for the price.  They also have as an option homemade, NY style pastrami.  The next time we're in the area, we'll be paying them another visit!
author: Gene D.

description:
I haven't gone to the Lou's on Geary cause I always thought the parking-headache there wasn't worth it for a sandwich. SO GLAD they have this Taraval location cause I've finally tried it and realized how much I've missed out. Definitely coming back here to explore the menu ^_^

RISKY BIZNESS - I recommend ordering it with the Dutch Crunch bread! Each bite was maaad delicious. There's pastrami, crab, bacon, avocado, and a whole bunch of other goodness inside this sandwich.
author: Bing L.

description:
Excited Lou's opened closer to home!  This location is more spacious & a lot brighter than their Geary location.  In addition, there are more seats for diners & parking is easier.

Since Lou's closes at 7:00 p.m., I called in to place an order.  Ordering via the phone was extremely easy and the person I spoke to was friendly.  

Ordered the following gourmet sandwiches:

Ami-Cado - This sandwich comes with pastrami, salami, avocado, pepper jack cheese, and Lou's special sauce on a soft roll.  It also comes with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, red onions, and jalapeño spread.  The sandwich is flavorful, but the pastrami and salami makes it a bit too salty.  Good thing Lou's special sauce and the jalapeño spread kicks the flavor up a notch as it has just the right amount of spice. 

Although I enjoyed my sandwich, I wished they gave me dutch crunch, which was noted when I placed the order.  Unfortunately, the person making the sandwich didn't follow the order correctly.  Hence, I'm taking away a star.  

Hot Pastrami - Parents enjoyed it.

Risky Business - Hubby thought it was just okay.  

Overall, great selections, affordable prices, good portions, convenient location, all wrapped into a pleasant experience.  

Note:  make sure you get a Lou's Sandwich Club frequent buyers card.  After buying ten, the next one is free.
author: Candice H.

description: Great and inexpensive sandwiches. Bread was super fresh and so were the vegetables. Light years better than chain sandwich places. Staff is very friendly. Comfortable neighborhood atmosphere. Highest recommendation.
author: Ken M.

description: They have the best sandwiches. Our school always order from them every time we have teachers' meetings. Meat lovers will love their AMI-CADO as well as the vegetarians would love their VEGGIE-LICIOUS. Also love their special sauce which gives a little kick to the subs.
author: Zarah L.

description: I love this cafe!!!! They use Boar's Head meats and the owner Mark is very dedicated to his work. He pours so much of himself into his business and in his products. He's got a very nice family too.  I love his wife, I guess you can call her my soul sister. I haven't been to the Cafe on Geary, but I've heard the lines are always out the door. I hope this family owned cafe sticks around for a very long time. I just appreciate how much devotion the owners put into giving customers quality products. Thanks for your genuinely nice customer service.
author: Maria M.

description:
Finally.  After many months of waiting we've got our own Lou's in the neighborhood.  Yippee.

More spacious than the one on Geary.  Plenty more seating.  And easy street parking although walking distance for me.  And an unisex restroom.  

Order a named sandwich off the board or design your own.  We're lazy so we ordered a named one.  We ate in.  This being the grand opening day, we were nosey neighbors.  We wanted to see how many folks were coming in while we ate.  Lots!!!  This is going to be a frequent eatery for us.
author: Shirley N.

description: This place NEVER disappoints! I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. The service is great and most of all, the sandwiches are like heaven in your mouth. The condiments are always really fresh and the meat is super tasty. The lines do get long during rush hour and it may take longer to receive your order so I do suggest going earlier.
author: Cee H.

description:
Oh Lou's.. *insert heart eyes emoji here*

I've been a recurrent customer at the Geary location since my undergrad days with it being just a couple minutes drive from the old stompin' grounds. Many self induced food comas were formulated here thanks to their hearty portions set at very reasonable prices. Thanks Lou's, you're the real MVP. 

I was pleasantly surprised to find this location and am happy to report the quality is just like I remember it to be. Parking is eh, manageable. Taraval is a busy street, so if you're a frequent flyer to the avenues, you'd know how street parking goes. On this particular day, there was no line and our sandwiches were made in a timely manner. 

We got the Turkey Cranberry, Veggie-Licious, and RB Mushroom (not pictured). The Ami-cado and Crabmelt were always my go-to's back in the day as well. Not to sound like a broken record, but their secret is most definitely in their Lou's special sauce and jalapeño sauce combo. Also...dutch crunch all day with these sandwiches...and Maui chips. Hashtag, no contrition.

I've tried the competition, trust me. IMO it's hard to tell if anything stacks up next to Lou's. Will always return when I can.
author: Lexy I.

description:
Lou's is great! We've been in the area for about a year now and having awesome little spots like this is the best. (don't be fooled though, SF natives we are)

Mark especially is very helpful and super chill. My personal go-to's are the breakfast sandwiches but I've been trying their other sandwiches for lunches. One time, I ordered the Ami-Cado and thought there was jalapenos in them, which I prefer not to have. I didn't realize it was only the spread and almost missed out. Mark gave me a side of spread and that's when I realized that that stuff is like crack. The Lou's special sauce is delicious too. 

Also, don't miss out on the clam chowder. It's heavy on the potatoes but I think that's okay too cuz there's still a good mix of clammy stuff but what reallyyyy tops it off is the little cheesy bread they give you for the soup. OMG it's like a little amuse bouche but not. 

If you find yourself coming here often, don't forget your stamp card. I think we've already scored 2 or 3 free sandwiches from me and the bf combined. 

In terms of costs, the breakfast sandwiches are a good size for the $5.50-$6.50 you spend. In regards to the larger sandwiches, I am able to split the sandwich for lunch 1 day and lunch the next day with a side of chowder for day 1 and a bag of chips for day 2 and am happy with my meal. I would say the prices are very worth it.

I'm happy they changed their hours just a little as it's very hard for me to grab a sandwich before 6pm after work and they open later than I start in the morning so this is a good adjustment for me.
author: Clarizeyale R.

description: Yumalicious. Every time I go here it's great. I love sandwiches and Lou's is hands down the best I've ever had. Great quality, friendly staff, good prices.
author: Kristie A.

description: This is my favorite sandwich spot! It's a great place to get a good size sandwich for a decent price. My favorite is the amicado.... The pastrami and salami taste soooo good with their sauce! I also like how their veggies are super fresh. The best part is the sandwich has never been soggy.... super plus!
author: Anjelica R.

description:
I inhaled the Roma's club sandwich. Meant to save half for later. That plan did not work out. I have no picture of the sandwich because I ate it so fast. All I'm left with is ... the menu. :-/

Oh well, maybe it will you decide what to order in advance.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Waited there before an appointment.
Comfortable and good coffee, friendly service :)
EGG Croissant was perfect and sliced with fresh layers ;)
author: Dianne A.

description: For an on the fly lunch, this turned out to be an excellent find!!!! Even the fire Dept was there to pick up sandwiches so you know it has to be good!!! Soft sweet rolls (name although not sweet), all the toppings, mmmmm! My husband and I had Italians. I couldn't even start the second 1/2 it was so big. Lots of meat and vegis. Would go there again!
author: M.D. C.

description: This place is pretty good. For breakfast I got the tortilla chicken salad and it was pretty fresh. I appreciate how they incorporate gluten free food and organic teas
author: Alyzah J.

description:
Reasonably priced (for SF).  8 to 9$ per sandwich.

Really like the Risky Business and the Hot and Sweet.
author: Sarah S.

description:
For the past 5 years that I have lived in San Francisco whenever people ask me for a really good sandwich spot, I've always defaulted to the tried and true answer of Ikes. It's probably the most recognizable and iconic sandwich shops in the SF bay area, and that not a bad thing. 

But...what I like about Lou's, is that it's not Ikes. It's a bit smaller, sometimes just as hectic, but the food is just as good, if not better. One thing that really stands out to me is how simple yet delicious their sandwiches have continued to be regardless of what I order on the menu.

Sometimes with Ikes you get almost too much, bread piled high with sauces, toppings, and veggies you lose track of what you really ordered, and even though it's delicious, you don't fully taste all the ingredients, and you lose a small part of that simplistic lunchtime classic. 

Lou's stands out in my mind as a fantastic drop-in sandwich shop that you could legitimately choose any item from the menu and end up with something incredibly tasty. Please visit Lou's, call in, order early, and eat up, and I promise you, you will not be dissapointed.
author: James C.

description:
Their sandwiches are STACKED! Like really stacked. I got the risky bizness with hot brisket pastrami, crab salad, pickles, banana peppers, avocados, swiss cheese and other fixings on Dutch crunch. 
     
      It was true love at first bite! The bread was nice and toasted on the outside and the inside was filled with hella meat with the appropriate amount of extras. The sandwich was a little big to eat everything in one bite but I can't complain because you really get your money's worth! All that for ~$9! Honestly you can even split it in half and eat it for 2 meals since it's so bigggg! 

     So eat up y'all!
author: Janet K.

description: Great variety, great creativity, but most of all great quality.  I've really liked every sandwich I've had here; and there are still a few types I need to try!  Service is friendly, the store is large and clean.  Neighborhood spot with fair prices.  If you're in the Parkside, you won't go wrong with Lou's.
author: David P.

description: I love Lou's!  Normally I stick to one or two items at a sandwich place but at Lou's I've tried nearly everything!  I've probably gone 15-20 times and have yet to get either a dud or a mistake. The mochas are also tasty. The folks working there have always been very nice, too.
author: Charles D.

description: Great sandwiches for a great price! I made my own sandwich with turkey, avocado, sprouts, multi grain bread and the works that comes with it. It was delicious. My boyfriend said it was the  best sandwich of his life. He had the Risky Business. High recommend coming here!
author: Amber L.

description: We have been back to Lou's a few times, and it is always 5 star. We learned from one poor experience that if they're busy and it seems like your order is taking longer than it should, keep checking back with them because sometimes things can fall through the cracks at any business.
author: Meredith S.

description:
Went looking for a place for lunch and stumbled into Lou's. Ordered the Chicken Pesto and Risky Business to go and split it with my friend. Both sandwiches were pretty good. The Risky Business definitely tasted meatier but that's not everyone's preference. 

The sauces also added a good kick and the dutch crunch is my favorite bread. I will definitely come back again.
author: Brandon L.

description: Their veggi licious sandwich is soooo good it's my favorite!!! Great place with variety of sandwiches and chips . They have friendly faces taking your order and making sandwiches . There is indoor seating.
author: Brigitte G.

description: Can never go wrong with Lou's. Staff here are always friendly and happy! Sandwiches are great, what more could you ask for.
author: Lena ..

description:
Great portions & high quality. They use high-quality meats from Boar's Head! There are also soo many options that it's a bit overwhelming. 

Bf tried the Risky Business sandwich and it was jam-packed with hot pastrami and crab salad. While this sounds like an odd combo, it was actually reallyyy good.

The salads here are also solid - fresh ingredients and good portions. I've tried the Greek salad with grilled chicken ($6.99 + $1.5 for chicken). The chicken was a teeny bit bland and honestly nothing really special, but it filled me up!
author: Samantha C.

description:
I've been coming almost every other day because their sandwiches are super delicious. I've tried many places in SF, but those sandwiches are the best for sure. Fresh soft bread, fresh delicious meat, fresh veggies. You can make your own special sandwich. Also workers are very friendly. 
And clam chowder soup with special bread. 
Everything is just perfect
author: Anastasia G.

description: Friendly atmosphere. Delicious sandwich and soup. Their special sauce just made the sandwich taste even better. Fresh bread too, perfectly toasted. No wonder it's so busy. Definitely worth the wait.
author: Mary Ann M.

description:
First time here - late lunch today, kind of glad I missed the lunch rush. 
Plenty of places to sit, sandwich made to order. 
Had the chicken pesto sandwich - very fresh - really good flavors with just a slight kick from the  jalapeños. 
I would come here again, lots of sandwiches to try.
author: Janet C.

description: Great sandwich spot with an unassuming exterior. I like coming here on laundry days because it's so close by and usually not too busy so I can grab a sandwich and hang out while the laundry finishes. My go-to's are the Ami-Cado and Risky Business but everything i've tried have been winners. The staff is friendly too.
author: Curtis W.

description: Got the risky business. The portion was huge! The Dutch crunch was soft on the inside but crunchy on the top and it paired perfectly with the meats and veggies. The quality is on par with Ike's. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Brenda N.

description: I'm pretty much obsessed with the veggie-licious sandwich. I think about when I can eat it next. The staff is always very friendly and the sandwiches are fresh and delicious.
author: Margaret M.

description: great veggie sandwhich and at a good price!! they actually put a lot into their sandwhich too unlike a lot of other sandwhich shops that have a veggie sandwhich.  highly recommend to vege eaters!!
author: James F.

description:
Good price, tasty sandwiches, and quick and friendly service. The Risky Business is so good! Life is amazing when you have heaping amounts imitation crab in your sandwich. 

Pro-tips:
- As with most sandwich places, call and order ahead for pickup. 
- Get a stamp card! Free sandwiches are the best sandwiches :)
author: Chloe T.

description: Try the risky bizness!  It's hella good!  The pastrami melts in your mouth, and the jalapeno spread (I ask for extra) adds a unique taste to the sandwich.  Get it!  You won't be disappointed!
author: Melofel O.

description:
PRAISE THE LORD I DONT HAVE TO DRIVE ACROSS GGP TO GET LOU'S ANYMORE!!!!

All SF natives would agree that this location is far more spacious, cleaner, and convenient than their location in the Richmond. Lou's has always been consistently AH-MAZE-ZING!!!!!

My favorites are: ami-cado, chicken pesto, lou-ben, and their chicken apple sausage breakfast Sammie!!!! SO GOOD TRUST ME, get Dutch crunch!! Their "special sauce" is really tasty and will never leave your sandwich dry.

Such a great location! I'm so happy they've opened in the Sunset :)
author: Kary Y.

description: This place has one thing - Sandwiches and not just a few kinds but boat loads of them with option to customize any order.
author: S J.

description:
Same goodness as the Geary location...

except they keep calling me SUSAN here. Please stop doing that. It's not my name and I fcking hate it.
author: Susy C.

description: Had the Italian special, and it was delicious. Can get crowded around lunch so be prepared. I'll be going back to it.
author: Fernando G.

description:
This place could not be better!
Like any coffee place they take your name but this place remembers. 
Sandwich after sandwich, salad after salad, one of the best San Francisco, super friendly places that always remembers your name. 
The CBR, BLT, I could go on, all fabulous, but my fingers are tired. 
Try it!
author: Thomas B.

description:
I love sandwiches.  
I love Lou's. 
I love stamp cards. 
I love Dutch crunch. 
I love toasted sandwiches. 


I order from Lou's probably weekly - I usually do a phone order and pick up and eat my sandwich in my pjs at home. The Taraval location is spacious and had seating and offers free water.  There is plenty of street parking (meters) in the hood. 

The service is fast, friendly and efficient as well.  Right now my favorite sandwich is the hot pastrami but I've had several of the sandwiches are they are all on point! Lou's is definitely in my lunch rotation.
author: Julie F.

description: Fresh, tasty, and very filling for one's tummy hehe
author: Stacey M.

description: I am so so happy that they opened a new location closer in SF! Better chances of parking and a much closer distance from home. I have always been a big fan of the Crab Melt Sandwich and this place is no different! The service is great and they have a large selection of yummy chips to chose from. I would definitely come back for more - mmmm!
author: Victoria K.

description:
Tried Lou's today for the first time and split the Ami-cado with my boyfriend. There was only a few people there, so I got my sandwich pretty fast, in and out in around 10 mins. The workers seem a little confused because the lady that took my order didn't give me my number/receipt, therefore I didn't know when to pick up my sandwich. However I do understand that the place is new and I guess they're still getting the hang of it and working out the kinks.

I loved the sandwich! I got the ami-cado on dutch crunch instead of the soft and sweet roll, and the dutch crunch was delicious!! Didn't cut up my mouth either, like some sandwich places do. The jalapeno spread added a small kick to it while the creamy avo cooled my mouth down. :D The only disappointing thing was that my sandwich wasn't as big as I expected from the pictures I've seen on yelp! It wasn't stuffed with meat/veggies, instead it was pretty flat. I was impressed by the taste but definitely let down by the size. Maybe next time the sizes will be more consistent /:

Lou's is a 3.5 for me but hopefully it'll increase to a 4 the next time I visit! There's still a lot of sandwiches I wanna try, so i'm glad it's close to my house!
author: Tara A.

description:
Weekend isn't a weekend without a Saturday sandwich run to Lou's. We live close enough that we can call our order in and pick it up within a few minutes.

We are such fans of the Kickin' RB and the Loquito that we haven't tried anything else... But both of these are top quality. I just wish they were open on Sundays, too!
author: Amy B.

description:
I only live a few blocks from Lou's (RIP Sevans) so its super convenient to get my sandwich fix. 

I had the breakfast sandwich that had a really good sauce. It was a nice small snack for the morning. 

The second time I bought the meatball sandwich. The small meatballs were underwhelming and could've used more. I think I had like a meatball and a half on each half sandwich. 

I do still really like the menu and would go back to try more. I would make sure just to go at the right time to avoid the lunch rush hour.
author: Anastasia P.

description: Our favorites are the Amicado, Risky Bussiness, and the Lou Ben with everything on it, but I feel like you can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches that's on the menu. Although we practucally go to Lou's once every week or so, we always  read through the menu to figure out what we are craving that day. The list of choices is pretty long and there are so many combinations of meat, veggies, and cheese that it's hard to decide. On some of the sandwiches it comes with the special Lou's sauce and it tastes amazing! Starting to Crave Lou's now as I am writing this review.
author: Chocolate P.

description: I got the Vegilious sand which and it was AMAZING. It had eggplant, mushrooms, bell peppers, avocado and tasted so good with their sauce. The bread was nicely toasted as well. Loved the customer service and lay out of the restaurant. Will definitely stop by again!
author: Cynthia R.

description: Love this place with their yummy sandwiches, great quality, I'll take my lunch every day that I'm at school, great sandwiches also you can ask for To make it as Salad.
author: Farnaz S.

description:
Pretty delicious sandwiches. They are efficient unlike Grubbin'. Their Lou sauce and jalapeño sauce is pretty legit and does make everything taste better.  Only bad thing is they don't pick up their phones. So don't bother calling to place an order.  

My favorites are LLB Special, BBQ chicken, RB mushroom and risky business.  

They should really subscribe to eat24 or order ahead to increase their clientele.
author: Michael T.

description:
Had the Taco Salad and an espresso with splash of cream.  The taco salad comes with chicken that seemed kind of like those bagged prepared strips - I'd expect real chicken for the price. Also, thousand island dressing - I prefer it with salsa and a dollop of sour cream, but this is a cafe. Which leads me to the espresso drink I ordered - with a splash of cream. It was handed to me with the lid on - to go, no worries. I taste it - tastes funky - remove lid and see whipped cream??? Who does that? Food was mediocre - I was being lazy and didn't want to cook. Seems like sandwiches are the thing here. 

Lessons: read the menu and ask for substitutions and don't get whipped cream in your espresso - it was disgusting. 

Also, their to go packaging was all plastic - c'mon, isn't that banned now, and we should be receiving compostable containers and silverware. We only have one planet - do your part Lous!
author: Christine V.

description:
On this trip I enjoyed the Roma Club. My wife and I have moved to San Antonio, Texas, but we never miss an opportunity to enjoy a Lou's sandwich when we are in town. 
The ingredients always taste fresh and the Lou's special sauce and Jalapeño spread make their sandwiches unique, flavorful, and add that perfect amount of "kick" to accompany the garlicky spread and salty meats. I could eat here everyday... I would if I could! 
Aside from the many sandwiches on the menu (my crazy sister-in-law enjoys veggie sandwiches with bacon - and they have one!!) you can also build your own. There is definitely something for everyone. 
The wait can be long, but you can call in your order ahead of time if time is an issue. Trust me, it's worth the wait.
author: Erik R.

description:
I never went to the Lou's Cafe at the Geary location, but this new one on Taravel sure as hell caught my tiny eyes. 

My mother and I were first timers, so we took our time scanning the menu. 
I must say though, the girl working the cashier wasn't the friendliest. She didn't give us a bad attitude, but she had no smiles and looked like she hated her job with all her might. 

-Crab Melt w/ everything : Imitation snow crab salad, avocado, american cheese, Lou's special sauce, on a dutch crunch roll
          Man oh man, this was GOOOOD. The sauces mixed in with the avocado and melted cheese was just AMAZING. However, I think that they were a little bit stingy on the crab and the avocado. Very thin layer of crab salad and 2 pieces of avocado just right in the middle.

-Turkey Cranberry w/ no pickles : Turkey, swiss cheese, cranberry, Lou's special sauce, on a sour dough roll
          I decided to switch to a dutch crunch roll because sour dough makes me cringe. They were really nice about it, no extra charges or anything. This was extremely delicious, but the person who made this sandwich put most of the sauce in the middle, so the first few bites were HELLA sweet. I would open the sandwich up and spread the cranberry evenly next time I get this. 

-Chicken Apple Sausage Sammie : Chicken apple sausage, american cheese, egg, hash browns, lou's special sauce, on a ciabatta
         A really good breakfast sandwich. My mom and I are big fans of chicken apple sausages so this was really good. She did need to add some salt and pepper to the hash brown and eggs though because they were pretty bland. The sizes of the breakfast sandwiches are a tad small than the normal ones, but also cheaper 

--Everything Includes: lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, pickles, jalapeno spread-- 

I'm definitely coming back, but I do hope that the cashier is friendlier next time and that they don't squish everything in the middle of the sandwich -__-
author: Jackie T.

description:
It is a family-owned Cafe. They prepare the best sandwiches in the whole wide world. They are amazing. I keep coming back to this craving for Louis sandwiches. Excellent service and food.
.
author: Romit P.

description: Get that sandwich with the hot links. Yeah, that's the stuff. Quality sandwiches...come here. Really awesome people work here. They are friendly and patient and make the sandwiches here with care. You don't have to worry about a sloppy tasting order. The toppings are fresh and that makes the food here that much better. Really Really good here. Call in advance if you don't want to wait.
author: Robert F.

description:
I gotta give it them.. You definitely don't want to skip out on the jalapeño sauce and the Lou's special sauce together, yes together! 

I got the Hot Pastrami on Dutch Crunch. They got my order wrong. I said no pickles and I got pickles. I said pepper jack cheese and I got cheddar cheese. Ummm..??? 

Nevertheless, hot pastrami was peppery and salty -- pretty tastyy. Sandwiches are a good size. Dutch crunch bread was a bit stale. Lettuce and tomatoes were fine. Service is quick here.
author: Ellen W.

description: Trying another sandwiches shop on Taravel street. This place has comfortable seats. Sandwiches was huge. Clam Chowder tasted good. They have a lot of different kinds of drinks to choose but not appetizers. Also, their restroom is excellent clean at this moment, not sure if it is because the shop is still new. Yes! I am picky with the restrooms.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Lou's offers a good value for sammies.  all sammies has 1/4# meat, boars heads featured. 

menu: gourmet salads, gourmet sammies, expresso, breakfast sammies or design ur own (6.74+)

eats:italian special(7.54)
-"ham, salami, mortadella, provolone cheese, lou's psecial sauce, dijon mustard on 
a soft & sweet roll" 
-includes "lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, pickles, jalapeno spread.
-red onions tasted spicy, sammie definitely had taste. good value

crumbs:
-10-15 wait, sammie made to order, many multi-sammie orders.
-metered parking in front.
-unlike geary st. lots of seating here.
-not sure what i really like, italian close but not the one......
-fast, friendly, order taking.......
-umbra? coffee offered.
author: Victor G.

description:
Lou's is consistently delicious with amazing customer service, great portions, and high quality meats and produce sliced to perfect for every sandwich.

I come here a lot( my wallet thinks a little too often) and always enjoy my delicious sandwich. My favorite is the loquito (turkey, avacado, tortilla chips, the fixin's, and jalapeno spread), but I plan on trying all of them at least once. 

The drinks are good too, with a solid cup of coffee or late. 

Though the sandwiches are cheap, the quality and deliciousness make up for it and is well worth it.
author: Shira S.

description:
Welcome addition to the neighborhood! Needed a good sandwich spot as Submarine Center has disappointed the last few times. The dutch crunch at Lou's is phenom. It's super fresh, it has the right amount of "cheese" to make the "crunch." Ordered the roast beef with mushrooms. It might be one of my new favorite sandwiches. It's a perfect balance. Good amount of veggies with the magic spread. The sandwich was HUGE! I gobbled it all up after rock climbing at mission cliffs. 

Good amount of seats, but most people grab and go.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Highly recommend the Risky Business.  Solid sandwich right there.  So far, this is the best sandwich spot I've found in the area.
author: Mike N.

description:
Not your average sandwich...the Lou's sauce and jalapeño sauce combo add a great kick to your meal. So many choices to pick from...all types of bread, cheeses, meats, and toppings. The service is great as well and the owner is super friendly.

If you're looking for a nommy sammy, I would definitely recommend this place. Another great sandwich cafe to add to my list!
author: Sara P.

description:
Never heard about Lou's until my friend bought me a sandwich from the Geary location. Now that there is one on Taraval and it's closer, I am truly addicted. Let me just start by saying, dutch crunch is life.

So far, I've had the RB Mushroom and Chicken Pesto from this location. I've also had the Veggielicious and the Lou-Ben from the Geary location. All sandwiches are amazing. Their sauce here is a nice spicy kick but not too spicy that you won't enjoy the sandwich. 

The people working here are friendly for the most part. They are as quick as they possibly can be, given that there's always a line. 

Only thing that needs improvement is air circulation. The last few times I've stopped by, it's been kinda stuffy...even with the door open.

**Make sure to check your sandwich. I requested dutch crunch on my chicken pesto and they forgot :(
author: Rebecca T.

description: Great family & local business. Quick turnaround time, friendly service and decent sandwich. Prices are in the $8+ ranges. Parking isn't abundant. They offer free tap water.
author: Cee B.

description:
Wow really good fresh meats and products 
Roast beef and mushroom was the bomb
 defenetly coming back great taste and fresh
author: L G.

description: Been there twice now and service is quick and friendly. I've had the ami cado, rb mushroom, and the original breakfast sandwich. First two great flavor, however, made the mistake of ordering breakfast one to go. I know that one must rock right off the grill,with the hash brown being crispy,not sitting in a bag steaming itself to a limp state. I love ordering extra special sauce for you can taste it more, which is definitely not a bad thing. Metered parking, so shove a nickel in, or not, and go get your sandwich, and enjoy.
author: Luis S.

description: I always seem to try a new thing on menu and have yet to be disappointed. Besides large portions, its actually great tasting large portions. I love their selection, price (i'm talking about you and your like-minded amigos Ike), quality and customization. One of the best in SF for sandwiches for sure. BBQ chicken w/ avocado + bacon is my favorite.
author: John O.

description: I arrived at 11am and there was no line. Service was attentive and not much of a wait. My turkey and cranberry sandwich was huge for only $7.74 (plus tax). Great sandwich, can't wait to try more items from here.
author: Liz N.

description:
Lou's Cafe! Welcome to the neighborhood! There has been several attempts at a good sandwich joint in this area and none of them cut it. This place, however, is LEGIT. Boar's Head meats, fresh breads, and fine produce play the lead roles - not to mention Lou's Special Sauce and the Jalapeño Spread. I was hungry, so I ordered a bowl of chili with my sandwich. Now, the chili was delicious, but the sandwich was so HUGE, I barely got through 3 or 4 bites of it  - looks like chili for dinner tonight! I've never been to the original shop over on Geary, but if it's this good. No wonder it's a San Francisco tradition! 

Next trip, I'm gonna try the Cobb salad and a bowl of chowder. Oh, and they have an espresso bar and a great looking breakfast sammy menu. It appears I'll have to go back. Soon. And often.
author: Justin H.

description: Sandwiches are legit! Super friendly staff... I'm only giving four stars though because they don't use fresh onions. I can still smell the onions on my hands from last night despite showering and washing my hands a few times. My hope is they will read this and cut their onions the same day of use and we can continue to enjoy those delicious sandwiches in he future! Cheers!
author: Wendy C.

description:
Lou's Cafe is one of our go-to spots in the neighborhood. Living just a few blocks away, Lou's is perfectly convenient for those nights when you just don't have it in you to cook. 
Mark is always in a great mood and does a superb job building relationships with his customers. 

They use top-notch ingredients and never fail to make a delicious sandwich or salad. My personal favorite is the chicken pesto sandwich. Breakfast sandwiches won't disappoint either! On my way to pick up dinner now...
author: Lindsay M.

description:
I live down the street from the one on Geary, but have never been.
Now I know how lucky I am!

I was going to design my own, but got lazy and chose the RB Mushroom-something-or-other on a soft roll.   Good balance of juicy meat & fixin's.  And even though the bread was toasted, it was still nice and soft inside.  And the special sauce?  MMM.  My friend wrapped up half of hers to go, but I wasn't stopping so easily.

There was a good crowd there, keeping the register busy, but getting a table wasn't difficult.  

Sammie, soda & chips $13, not too shabby.
author: Ken B.

description:
I usually don't like to eat sandwiches or burgers, but I really like this place. I love the taste and the variety. I've tried the CBR, Chicken Pesto, and Space Balls sandwich and they were all delicious.

It's nice and bright inside and it's nice to sit in and eat. It was a good place to grab lunch to eat @Grand View Park :D  My church group sometimes order from here for dinner. Tastes great!

They don't open on Sundays (bummer). Every Sunday I tutor nearby, I always crave a sandwich for lunch (too bad for me).
author: Serena Z.

description:
Love the sandwiches here with the jalapeño spread.  Glad to see the new location on Taraval in the Sunset District. 

Call your order in and your sandwich is ready when you arrive.  

My favorites are the: meatball,  Italian special,  Turkey cranberry,  and the chicken pesto. 

The bread is always soft and fresh.
author: T L.

description: Good sandwiches at reasonable prices. Serves breakfast sandwiches all day. The sandwiches did not have enough sauce. Not as good as other famous sf sandwiches. However, a very good option if you are near by. A few vegetarian choices are available.
author: Sid P.

description: I'm a big fan of this place...but only when it's not super crowded since it can take awhile for them to make your sandwich. The breakfast sandwiches which are served all day are awesome and so much better and just slightly more expensive than a McDonalds egg mcmuffin. Service is great and they have a loyalty card. Dining area is a little small but I usually get it to go.
author: wendy w.

description: Service with a smile , food was delicious and busy Ka always a good thing ! I had the Crab Melt and the Italian and both were Satisfying ! I stay about an hour away but it's always worth the drive !
author: Ulysses U.

description: Just finished my 3rd sammy in abt 1 week. All different, all great. Their unique sandwich recipes have all been very satisfying so far. I will try to go thru the entire menu in about a month. Friendly attentive staff, super clean and tidy. I am now a regular.
author: Marko E.

description:
Sandwiches with a twist!

I came in here hungry and without high expectations, but boy was I lucky to walk past this place! I've eaten some pretty good subs & sandwiches in the past, but this place really adds a whole new level to the sandwich game. The chicken pesto sandwich is to die for! No seriously, it was probably the best sandwich i've ever eaten in my life... Amazingly tasty bread, succulent meat and a sauce that makes you crave for more... This place has it all! 

Anything bad about this place? Well, the choice of beverages is not that amazing, but hell... Who cares with sandwiches like these! Ill definitely be back the next time i'm in town.
author: Mike D.

description:
One of the best sandwiches I have had. I want to say it's their lou's sauce that makes it taste so good. 

I have tried all the vegetarian sandwiches on their menu and the soup they were delicious !
author: Milana R.

description: This was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had, hands down! My partner and I were driving through SF on a road trip and happen to stumble upon this place before heading back to LA. We managed to get in just before they closed early for Memorial Day and I couldn't be happier we did. I personally recommend the chicken pesto on sourdough (it comes with the soft and chewy loaf). Freshly baked and perfectly toasted bread with Boars head meat (the highest quality), lettuce, tomato, red onion, and a uniquely spicy jalapeño spread. The sandwich is HUGE and can easily be split into two portions. I had one half for lunch and the second came in handy a few hours later on the long drive back. My bf got the sausage link sandwich with some of the creamiest New England chowder I've tasted which could easily rival a Boston original. The employees were very kind and the service was fairly fast given how busy the restaurant was that afternoon. And on top of it all, incredibly affordable. Screw you, Subway and Quiznos. I will absolutely be back the next time I visit. Highly recommended!!!
author: Jeff W.

description: Came here because of the yelp reviews and definitely was not disappointed. The Risky Buziness was so unique and good at the same time. The bread was perfected both soft and crunchy, and I love the sauces they have.
author: Sean S.

description:
This is my favorite sandwich spot in the city. I go there about once a week, sometimes more. Typically I get the RB mushroom which is AMAZING but when I feel like switching it up I'll get a Lou Ben or a breakfast sandwhich, which are all amazing as well.
Basically, this place is like Ike's but doesn't try so hard to be hip, has much better prices and much faster service.
author: Graham S.

description:
Is there a six star option?!

Taste, quality, freshness, hospitality, cleanliness, price, selection.... All top notch and I could on!

Lou's was already my favoite sammy shop for the past couple of years so imagine my excitement when the new shop opened up in the Parkside / Sunset Dist. Right around the corner from me?!

Okay, back to the sammy in front of me. 

Lou's rocks!!
author: Joe A.

description: Best sandwiches in the city. I work in the neighborhood and consider myself a regular. The Lou's sauce is amazing!! I usually design my own sandwiches (I'm a little picky and don't eat cheese) and their ingredients never disappoint. Hot pastrami, Roma's club, ami-cado, and the tuna melt are some of the ones I tried back when I did eat cheese and those were all yummy. All their meats are Boar's Head brand which is top-shelf in my opinion, and the bread is always fresh. The breakfast sandwiches are also great, whoever came up with the idea to put a big hashbrown on a bacon & egg sammie AND on ciabatta is a genius. The line can get long around lunch time, but it's worth it!! Staff are super friendly too.
author: Shelby S.

description: This was our first time at Lou's and we will be back!  The sandwiches are so delicious.  All ingredients are very fresh and you can tell the sandwiches are made with care.  We tried the Chicken Pesto, Roma Club, and Loquito.  The Roma Club, with the Dutch Crunch bread, was definitely the yummiest.  The sandwiches are definitely large enough to share.  There were 3 of us and we each ordered our own sandwich so we had leftovers we brought home.  I think pretty much any sandwich there would be good.  We got there a good time because just after we ordered there was a line out the door.
author: Julie T.

description:
The "Risky Business" on dutch crunch w/ all the fixins was LEGIT!!!
Anxious to go back for another sammie and a salad
author: John H.

description:
I am from back east originally and if ever went back to NYC and strolled into a deli, was met by a guy named Vic or Sol, ordered a pastrami sandwich with crab meat and an aioli sauce; I would accept the vicious beating I would receive with joy.  COME ON, stop the madness, what's next, tuna fish with a hot mustard on pita beard served with a sardine dipping sauce or a grilled cheese with a tigers milk cranberry Brule.  

   Lou's is clean (a San Francisco MIRACLE for most places in this city are FILTHY) and welcoming.  A large menu featuring some of the most disturbing sando combinations on any planet, many would be illegal back east and fairly fast service.  The amount of food is reasonable and the quality is ok, they use Boars Head meat, a "chain" service that many places use.  There soup is out of the box and passable.  

   Yeah, I got it, I'm not hip.  I still believe a pastrami sando should be served on rye beard with yellow mustard and that's it.  I don't think seafood and deli meat should be in anyone's mouth at the same time and a sando, drink and chips should not cost 10 bucks.  I am going to have to get used to a changing world.  However, you better call some friends pal, because its going to take a whole army to hold me down and make me eat pastrami, cheese and avocado, please deli Gods, save the world from this madness.
author: Rusty G.

description: First place I tried after being away from the city for the summer and I had no regrets! I tried their Roma's club and England clam chowder and it was great! The workers were very nice and welcoming! Definitely will come back to this place!
author: Linh B.

description:
