Super delicious sandwiches! I'm obsessed!

I live next door so I come in kind of often. They're always as quick as they can be and the owner seems mad chill.

They have a nice selection of beverages too. And the clam chowder soup is really good. It comes with a garlic cheese bread.
author: Chrissy C.

description:
Truly, dearly, tasty sandwiches.

I got the first one on the menu, the amicado, and I must say, they truly do construct an impeccable sandwich.

They have a stamp card which I am slowly filling, and hope to redeem it soon trying one of their other curious sandwiches.

I am now putting mustard on this review.
author: Auza A.

description: They make some delicious sandwiches, but service was slowww. I ordered the Risky Business - hot pastrami brisket, crab salad, bacon, avocado, pepper jack cheese, pepperoncini, and Lou's special sauce on a Dutch crunch roll. The ingredients speak for themselves ~ amazing! The veggie-licious was also just as it's name describes it. But it took over 30 mins to come in, order two sandwiches, and leave! Some people ahead of us must have been ordering a dozen sandwiches because they were standing at the cashier forever, three people cut the line (one was a to-go order), and another person who phoned in an order was able to jump in-front of the line as well. After a long wait to order, the wait for the sandwiches to be made was also looong. In addition to the long wait, me being super hungry probably contributed to my impatience and sour attitude towards my experience. On the positive side, the food tastes good, the store is clean, they have stamp cards, and the workers are not rude. If you come here, be sure to phone in your order ahead of time...(so you can cut the line!)
author: Jean S.

description: The best sandwich place in San Francisco is spreading like wildfire. Fresh ingredients with quality Boar's Head meat. My perfect sandwich: Toasted Dutch Crunch, turkey, And bacon. Lou's never disappoints.
author: Darius A.

description:
Came here early in the AM to meet a friend for breakfast.  Locked eyes with the chicken apple sausage sammie and thoroughly enjoyed it.  A generous amount of sausage, egg, hash brown all on toasted ciabatta AND with Lou's special sauce--"an aioli based spread with garlic, mayo and other herbs".  Soooo good.

Business really started to pick up around 10:30/11am and by this time they had 11 trays of catered sandwiches ready for pick up.  Nice to see Lou's Cafe is thriving!

After breakfast, pleasantly surprised to find a strong wifi network.  Shifted over to the window counter seats facing Geary.  Plenty of outlets above the booth seating also.  Very likely that I will be adding this to my normal repertoire of local businesses.
author: Christopher W.

description: So many sandwiches to choose from! But not just any of the regular sandwich options! Let's just say this: I had a sandwich with bacon and crab. Took a risk to try it and it was incredibly good with their jalepenos spread.
author: Nairi M.

description: Now these guys can make a sandwich! This is their second store. A bit larger than the one on Geary. Other brother runs that one .I had the "Risky Business" on Dutch Crunch.....pastrami, bacon, crab salad, avocado and all the extras for under $9! Surely beats the recent sandwiches I've had for comparable prices ie Ike's and Grubbin (they charge $2 extra for meat)!  Wifey got the vegetarian loaded with goodies for under $8. Parking mid day was easy but we were there before 12. By the time we left most of the tables were packed and small line to order. Will definitely be my goto place for sandwiches.
author: Jordan K.

description:
Excellent sandwiches!  I got the risky business with both spreads and everything on it and the husband got the Italian minus all the spicy stuff. As big as the sandwiches were we both finished. My husband was surprised I finished since he almost couldn't manage! Newbie haha

The only negative for me was that the filling in the risky business wasn't consistent. The ends were empty so I ate those parts first.
author: Rosalind S.

description: What a great find! I had the risky business and it was so yummy! Dutch crunch bread was fresh, soft and perfectly toasted at the same time. Service was fast and friendly.
author: Ravenous T.

description:
I love that I live only a block away from this sandwich haven. Everything is delicious! If you're craving a sandwich that's satisfying yet delicious, come here! 

My go-to's are the LLB and Veggie-Licious. Before you say no to vegetarian sandwiches, you NEED to try theirs. PACKED with veggies and flavors and it will stuff your stomach up! My mouth is starting to water... I have also tried the Lou-Ben, Chicken Pesto, Kickin' R.B., and probably a few more that I don't remember. All are delicious!

As for wait, it depends. It can get crowded during the day, so call ahead if you don't want to wait! Aside from that, highly recommend this place if you're craving a delicious sandwich and am in the neighborhood!
author: Bonny C.

description: First time trying this place and I got the risky business.. Definitely did not disappoint! It was delicious! Plus the cashier was really polite..
author: Rochell S.

description: So glad I don't have to drive an extra ten minutes to Geary to get my sandwich fix! However, that location holds a special place in my heart as I went often during my college days. Brought every person I could there because the sandwiches are that good. This location is way bigger than the Geary location and has way more parking options. I'm like a broken record in my reviews because I always stick to one item from a restaurant but when I like something, I LIKE IT. And in this case, it's the tuna melt on a wheat roll (hold the pickles, bleh). I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy food, but the jalapeno spread is more tasty than spicy. If I can handle the subtle heat, anyone can believe me. The sandwiches are a pretty decent size, so when I'm hungry, it does it's thing filling me up. For around ~$9 it's a little cheaper than the famous Ike's, so that's a plus. One of my favorite sandwich places, hands down. Never disappoints. Try it! You won't be sorry.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Great sandwiches, huge and very filling have tried both the Ami-cado and Roma's Club. Though did go early on in the life of this particular branch and they seemed to be a little disorganized over-all particularly in sorting out letting customers in line waiting order with their phone orders. Hopefully they've gotten things better sorted out at this point.
author: Julie N.

description: If I could eat here everyday I would happily do so and not judge myself for it! I can easily say BEST. SANDWICHES. EVERRRRRRR. You will be instantly addicted. Great service even when the lines are insanely long.  Everyone that works there really pulls their weight!
author: Valerie E.

description: With all the sandwich shops on Taraval I've been to them all ONCE. But I will be coming back to this one! They opened yesterday, I was doing laundry across the street and looked and wah-la! Doors were opened. I walked in grabbed a menu, went home to wait for my clothes to dry. I read the entire menu and called in my order, picked it up brought it home. I was only gonna eat half but it was too good to let it wait. Veggie-Licious is DA BOMB. And they have my chocolate dipped Madeline's.
author: Roxanne O.

description:
I was super excited to try this place because I'd heard about the one in The Richmond many times before. I've now been to this location three times and I think that's enough to reasonably say that the sandwiches are okay (that is, the two vegetarian sandwiches specifically since I'm a vegetarian), but that I don't find anything really special about them. They were also always a bit soggy. I do find it interesting though how many meat-eaters actually love the veggie sandwiches here.

I do like the location on Taraval, right off the L line. I don't like the amount of time it takes to order and get a sandwich. It's not a place I'd recommend if you're on a time crunch. 

If I'm on Taraval, I'll probably stick to Gene's (a classic) or just take a short trip over to Java Beach.
author: Gloria B.

description: Such a fan. Staff is so sweet and I love their sandwiches. Bread is fresh.  And unlike many other places which suffer at the hands of a diverse menu, Lou's does everything well!
author: Katie K.

description:
Best sandwiches in SF and now down the street and on this side of the park.

Would keep this secret to myself, since I don't want to wait in long lines, but businesses on Taraval have less foot traffic and I would like Lou's to be around for a long long time.

Breakfast sandwiches (Corned Beef, Sausage, Bacon) are awesome and I usually get the Lou-Ben, their version of the Reuben with Pastrami and Turkey with Dutch Crunch instead of Soft French.

Very friendly and very accommodating to complicated orders.  5 plus stars!
author: EJ K.

description:
If they are out of Dutch crunch your not going to get the full experience. I will admit it's a pretty dam good sandwich and the the sauce adds a nice touch.
     
     I had the hot link today and I was pleasantly surprised how good it was. There's one problem they don't go that extra step and peel off the skin. When the skin is left on it makes it really hard to eat and takes away from the sandwich. My other issue is the lettuce that they use. I prefer iceberg lettuce in my sandwich. 

      This place is an above average sandwich shop but at the same time over rated in my opinion. They also use Boars Head meat which I am not a fan of. I be leave you can't get 5 stars using that meat. It seems that everyone now days uses Boars Head. It also seems that all these new shops can't make a simple, fresh, good sandwich. They have to get all crazy with different shit all up in them. Don't get me wrong I do enjoy crazy shit in my sandwich, but some times all I want is a simple good sandwich and that's is hard to find. 

     I base all my sandwiches on Submarine Center.  Their hot link sandwich called the hot smokey and they peel off the skin and use iceberg lettuce. I say that Subs makes best sandwiches of all time. A sandwich should have fresh ingredients, good meat, iceberg lettuce and simple.
author: Greg H.

description:
Omg!!! Could not be more excited!!! Lou's now closer to home!! Turkey cranberry and crab melt for the win! I love this place. Drove by, noticed a familiar logo, read it, it said Lou's, I said "what?!" Turned my car around, parked and went in! They've been open since last Tuesday. 

My heart is just bursting with happiness!!!
author: Thuy M.

description: This place is amazing!!!!!! The sandwiches are bomb.com lol.... the place isn't that big but the sandwiches are very delicious. They prepare them with fresh ingredients. My family and I just got here, all of us tried a different one and all of us loved them. Will definitely come here again when I'm back in the area. They also have a very extensive menu. These guys are doing it right. Very nice service as well.
author: Ignacio E.

description: Been here 3 times already. Really solid sandwich place. Perfectly toasted bread, jalapeño spread with just the right amount of kick. Big fan.
author: Karl K.

description: Great. I order on the phone and the sandwich is ready when i get there. Taste fresh soft and easy to enjoy
author: Yosof R.

description: One of my favorite sandwich spots in the city! Love the quality, the Dutch crunch, & OOOUU the Amicado is amaze balls! Don't miss out! Definitely stop by to grab a bite :) never a disappointment!
author: Anne C.

description:
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! Lou's special spread makes their sandwiches fabulous. The sandwich is probably a little less than a foot long. I ordered the Ultimate Sub (which has 5 different meats in it) for about $7-$8. I ordered it with everything except the jalapeño spread. It was sooo delicious!! I also ordered a 16oz peach Italian soda $2.25. 

My friend ordered the Risky Business sandwich about $8-$9 without the jalapeño spread. It was also VERY delicious, but I prefer the Ultimate Sub. We also ordered clam chowder which came with a thin slice of cheese bread. Didn't like the chowder, but it wasn't awful. 

My other friend ordered the BBQ Chicken sandwich, but he thought it was only "okay." He said it was a little better than Java Beach's BBQ Chicken sandwich. 


The cafe is very nice and clean! The atmosphere is great. 

Bottom line: COME TO THIS PLACE AND TRY THEIR SANDWICHES!! Reasonably priced and so amazing!!!!
author: K T.

description: I don't like sandwiches. Or wraps or things where people just load a bunch of random crap onto bread. So believe me it's epic that I had to psych myself into taking that second half of the Risky Bizness home instead of shoving it into my face. Hubby is a vegetarian and made a cheese Sammie and got it toasted, a  nice touch from the usual cold cheese sandwich. We didn't have much of a wait at all. I might consider driving up here from Santa Cruz just to get me some of that again.
author: Heather M.

description: Yum! Believe the hype. Great ingredient quality and friendly staff, as good or better than Ike's.
author: Jon J.

description: Sublime sandwiches. They will transport you. Sauces are great and unique. Glad there is one this side of the park.
author: E. W.

description: Ordered the veggie. It was wet and I felt like a walking, talking jar of pickle juice afterwards. Barely any avocado for the money. I would rather buy an avocado and a bag of chips next time I'm starving at work. Any bag of chips would do and the avocado can be firm for all I care. This sucked. Geary was better.
author: David T.

description:
OMGGG THANK YOU LOU'S CAFE for opening up in the Sunset!! :D Now I can eat here more often when I'm craving for one of your yummy sandwiches (which is often)!

 Anyways stopped by here on a lunch break with my coworker and this time I had ordered the Risky Bizness lettuce wrap instead of having bread, since I'm trying to do a low carb diet for my upcoming trip! I also got extra jalapeño and the garlic sauce on the side. And I got my coworker the Amicado...my treat! =) They gave me a stamp card and both the wrap and sandwich costed me less than $20 (super affordable)! It also only took them about 10 minutes to make. 

My wrap was soOo good and flavorful!! And even though it was a little more difficult and messier to eat, it was well worth it! I also felt healthier eating it too even though I was spreading both sauces on there with almost every bite! LOL...anyways again I'm super excited for this new location and I know they will definitely thrive here in the Sunset and will be just as popular as their Geary location! Oh and there were also other popular sauces available inside too such as Sriracha, if you like that in your sandwiches.
author: Mary C.

description:
Huge sub sandwiches and super friendly service. I've been to both the Geary location and this new one in Sunset many times and love both. This one is more spacious than the one on Geary and it has lots of seating. The signature subs are great and my favorite is the Roma's Club. My favorite breads are Dutch Crunch and Soft & Sweet Roll.

These sandwiches are super hefty with meat, bread, and sauce, so this is not a light meal. I've also had the salads and soups before and they're all excellent. Soup comes with bread with melted cheese on top.

According to other Yelpers it also looks like you can ask for a lettuce wrap instead of bread -- I'll have to try that!
author: Jennie W.

description:
This is our new local sandwich place!  My son loves the Ultimate Club and my Dad loved the Roma Club.  I've had the Hot Pastrami before and loved it.  I'm not a vegetarian, but occasional I would order a veggie sandwich.  Today, I order the Veggie Licious and it was awesome!!  I didn't miss the meat at all!  The sandwiches are toasted which enhances the flavors.  You gotta have the garlic and the jalapeño spreads on it too!  

The owner and staff are super nice and the cafe is very clean and organized.
author: Reg W.

description: So glad this place is very close to home and esp. convenient when I'm on my way to a Giants game!  I've passed by few times, have read great reviews about the original location on Geary, and have been meaning to try.  The outside is reminiscent of A&W...perhaps it's the brown and warm orange colors on their sign and awning. Walking in, the shop is very spacious and clean; their gourmet sandwich menu is quite varied and each sandwich includes their special sauce; expect to pay roughly $7.   Ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich on a sweet soft roll.  While I enjoyed their sandwich I felt the cheese and their special sauce made the sandwich a bit too saucy, and lacked the BBQ flavor.  I will return for another different sandwich, but one that's on Dutch-crunch instead.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Sister location of the Geary location.  Everything on the menu is the same and same good quality.  Service is definitely A+ with this family run business. Their special sauce definitely is makes me coming back. I recommend their breakfast sandwiches, Ami-Cado and Turkey Cranberry. Their bread are bought fresh every morning for the day. Their clam chowder is also a regular side for me. 

This location is definitely bigger than the their Geary location. Has free Wi-Fi as well. I found lots of parking  every single time.

To sum it up - Lou's Cafe didn't lose any quality when opening this expanded location. You want good sandwiches cone here. Quality is #1.
author: keith s.

description:
Walked by the place a few times on the way home from work. Its new, its clean and the staff is very friendly! The sign looks old school San Francisco in beige, brown and orange so may blend in too much to the surrounding buildings. If you cant find it, its across the street from clean express next to some kind of sanrio/pikachu store. 

The sandwiches are nice and tasty. Ingredients are fresh and you get a whole lotta options. I tried the meatball today but im excited to try the others. Be careful, the dutch crunch was a little tough on the top for some reason. (almost stale? But thats not right cause the rest of the roll tasted fresh). I order dutch crunch all the time and i dont know if its the bakery where they get the bread or maybe its how its stored and toasted. 

I am a fan of the other sandwich places that popped up on Taraval and I can see that Lou's has some stiff competition but I have some issues with these spots too. Here are a few other players: Trolleys is never opened; Grubbin runs out of dutch crunch and the line is rediculous sometimes. 30minutes for a sammy? Chop chop guys.. Their menu is also smaller so less choices; Genes is a corner store deli so its more grab and go. 

Give Lou's a try if you want variety and a nice friendly environment to enjoy a nice and filling meal.
author: David Q.

description: Fresh warm buttery bread, fresh meats, spicy jalapeño spread with just the right zing. Thank you Lou's for providing me a nice lunch. I will be back.
author: Sandy N.

description: I ordered the tuna melt with everything in it  with extra lettuce and tomatoes.  It tasted very yummy. It was a hug sandwich so I saved part for dinner.   I will be back to try different sandwiches.
author: Ken S.

description: Call your order in advance and enjoy a bomb ass sandwich. Yummy sandwiches that totally hit the spot.
author: Monica C.

description: I am a meat lover but their veggie sandwich is amazing and full of flavor! I'm certain their other sandwiches are delicious but the veggielicious is the only thing I order. Conveniently located for a quick to-go sandwich and they offer loyalty cards that get you a free sandwich every 10 purchases.
author: Yiorgo L.

description: Lou's is my FAVORITE sandwich spot. I love the Italian Special with extra Lou's special sauce and hubbie likes the Amicado. We probably get those sandwiches at least twice monthly and they are consistently delicious! You know you've found a gem when it tastes just as good as the first time you've had it. The staff and owner (Mark) are also super friendly. This is one sandwich spot you need to try if you are in the city.
author: C W.

description: I'm not big on buying sandwiches because why buy something when I can make it at home? But hooooooly hell there sandwiches are so so incredibly good. I love lou's!
author: Marlene G.

description: The ingredients were top tier and the quality of sandwich superb. Second time here and both times my sandwiches were served to perfection.
author: Martin R.

description: Good place to grab a sandwich during lunch. I normally get the americado with extra meat. Sometimes I add clam chowder but the sandwich alone will get you full. The wait is normally about 5 mins so it's not to bad. Nice clean place with decent amount of seating a for a sandwich place. Would recommend this place for anyone craving for a sandwich.
author: Phi N.

description: Hands down favorite sandwich place ever. You can't go wrong getting your sandwiches on dutch crunch. Each sandwich is pretty big and packed with meat. Plus, their special sauce is to die for. My go to sandwiches are the ultimate club, Roma's club, and the LLB special, but honestly, i'm sure any of their sandwiches are two thumbs up!
author: Eileen L.

description: I love Lou's! I don't usually write reviews, but wanted to write a review for this location because they deserve all the business in the world. The customer service is impeccable, the entire restaurant is spotlessly clean, and the food is delicious. There is a long menu of tasty stuff. Go here!
author: Tori H.

description:
I was looking for someplace new to go for a sandwich and liked the good reviews this place got.  I'll now add one more.  This is a fantastic little cafe!  Clean tables, floor and other interior features.  Bright paint and good lighting.  Quick and friendly service.  And the sandwiches!  I enjoyed the hot link, a friend enjoyed the Roma's Club, and the hot pastrami might be the best, most unique I've ever had.  Fresh dutch crunch roll, lean brisket, tasty veggies and cheese, and the combination of jalapeño spread and Lou's Special Sauce (trust them, you want them together on your sandwich!) give it a great kick!  There's a nice selection of drinks and kettle-cooked chips to round out your meal.  Salads, soups, and breakfast also available, though I haven't had those.

What a great new find.  Thanks Yelp!  The newer Lou's is just a short drive from pretty much anywhere in the southwestern corner of the City or Daly City.  Go once, get a stamp card (10th sandwich is free) and go back often!  But heed the street signs and meters -- SF DPT are vultures around there!
author: Howard S.

description: Best sandwiches in SF!! Multiple locations around SF. Wide variety of sandwiches with great flavor. Special sauce is a must.
author: Julian C.

description: I didn't expect much from this nondescript spot on taraval but I was wrong. The sandwiches are on point due in large part to great bread and homemade spreads alongside creative sandwich combinations. I have become a regular patron.
author: Allison B.

description: Lous is always a go-to, even with GREAT sandwich shops nearby! Taraval or Geary, call-in your order!
author: Kyle N.

description: I really enjoy their veggie sandwich here. I like this location since it's not too packed. Service is fairly quick
author: Vivian L.

description:
first time trying Lou's Cafe!  glad they made one on taravel so it's closer to me. parking is consisted of meters and street parking. it wasn't too bad and I easily found street parking at 11pm. there was a lunch line and the wait was about 10-15 minutes, I suggest people to call ahead if they know what to get! or peep the menu online in advanced to call in.

got the famous ami-cado with pastrami, pepper jack and avocado (without the extra topping price)  it usually comes on a soft roll, but I subbed it for Dutch crunch because I just can't resist that hearty crunchy bread.  yummy!

first impression - from the looks, it was delicious!  not too stingy on the meat and toppings either.  first bite was delicious!  fresh ingredients and tender pastrami topped with the pepper jack cheese. it also comes with the usual pickles, lettuce, tomato and their famous jalapeno and garlic spread.  this spread comes on all the sandwiches, but can be subbed or taken off by request!

jalapeno spread - soooo good.  not too spicy and just the right amount of kick needed.  the spice was perfect with the hot pastrami.  

garlic spread - yummy as well!  i can see how people would think two spreads would be overwhelming, but i love the sauce.  the spread was garlicky, creamy and delicious.  i'm all for the spreads.  these spreads are mayo-based.

space balls - the meatball sandwich w/ marinara sauce.  yummmmmy.  tender meat balls with an awesome sauce.  nothing too extravagant, but i do enjoy my meatball subs.  

my only complaint would be a bit of a wait for my sandwich and finding out my bread wasn't even that toasted.... (both sandwiches) everything on the sandwich was on point, but i really wish the sandwich was a bit more toasted for the amount of time i waited.  the cheese wasn't all that melted either.  next time, i'll probably tell them to toast it longer?  not sure if it's the style for them to jus lightly toast it, but i just prefer the nice crunch.

i will be back!!!  i'm excited to try other things on the menu and also the choice to make your own sandwich!
author: Josie L.

description: Since I've been coming back a few times- I'm definitely maintaining my five stars! And I notice that the lines are not as long over here compared to Geary which can get overwhelming- so definitely a major plus. Personal Favorites: Veggielicious, LLB Special and Ami-Cado.
author: Allyson L.

description: Lou's Cafe is one of my favorites! I'm not a vegetarian but I always get veggielicious and add little bit of meat :) Unlike any other vegetarian sandwiches, it's super delicious, light but filling without any guilty feelings.
author: Nana K.

description: I am really picky when it comes to sandwiches.  I have no complaints about this place.  Actually I can't stop thinking about how delicious the sandwich I had here was.  I had the RB With mushrooms, and added avocado.  No lettuce no pickles.
author: Marvella W.

description: One of the best sandwich shops around. Always crowded fresh ingredients, the clam chowder is just like if you go to Wharf and better than most there. Friendly staff.
author: Philip G.

description: These are the best sandwiches I've had in a long time.  Their bread is from Bordenave's in Marin, which is the bread place my parents used for their sandwich shop 20 years ago.  I am in love with the Tuna Melt, although have also tried the Ami-Cado (really good), the Roma's Club (really good), and the Spaceballs (my son tried this one and liked it).  Friendly staff.  Nice little place, well-maintained and looks clean.
author: Elaine H.

description: Keep in mind, you guys are the newest and adding competition to the other several sandwiches places on Taraval within a good 1-2 mile radius. And I like this place in the Richmond district, but when I tried this new one somewhat recently, I had ordered the Space Balls or meat balls sandwiches and was disappointed. I literally had 4 meatballs in my sandwich, like 2 on each half and felt cheated! like I was eating mostly bread with lettuce, cheese and tomato since 2 meatballs does not cover half a whole sandwich. Next time I'll just try something else. But, since I felt cheated, I'd rather go to Grubbin or Gene's liquor for sandwiches.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Lou's Cafe sandwiches in Sunset? No longer need to go on over to Geary?  Woohoo! The sandwiches here are just as good as ever and it seems more spacious at this location.  They do not skimp on ingredients and these are great value sandwiches.  The menu has just about any combination sandwich you could think of and if nothing suits you, you can make your own.  Lastly, Lou's special sauce is ahh-mazing!  Just try it.
author: Renee L.

description: Bar NONE. The bomb. Both spreads are delish. Very reasonable prices for toasted sandwich. Love it. Mark B the owner is best.
author: J H.

description:
++2nd location to open along their sister store on Geary Blvd
++Accepts credit cards
++Efficient, friendly service
++Plenty of parking

What attracted me here: Not a first timer so I already knew what to expect! I love that it is conveniently located near Ocean Ave where I work. Guess I found my new lunch spot:D

My Experience: Lou's Cafe is nothing short of a great experience. I'm a bit embarassed I can't remember her name, but the woman who helped me at register is an absolute delight! She's really friendly and helpful if you need a recommendation or have questions about the menu. I usually opt for the LLB or RB Mushroom, but decided to cave in to try the Vegilicious as many people have raved about. It's almost exactly like the Veggie Delight, but includes EGGPLANT! My sandwich, for about under $7, included lettuce, tomato, avocado, eggplant, peppers, and their famous Lou's sauce and jalapeno spread. The combo of their sauce and spread gives a nice kick at the end. The ingredients blended in together nicely. The only downfall is to eat it shortly after ordering. I took it back to my office immediately to eat and the bread was already beginning to soak in the juices from the eggplant / peppers / tomatoes. But it was still soooooo good! I tried to save half but instead of doing a disservice to the delicious sandwich, I scarfed it all down, don't judge me.
author: Connie C.

description:
Jumping on the 5 star bandwagon.  

--The service was great.  I didn't feel like they were hovering but they were always attentive whenever I wanted something.

--Wifi was fast (closer to Starbucks than Peets) 

--So clean.  A lot of times with not-full-service cafes people often leave a mess and I end up having to wipe down the table before I sit down. Not the case here.  Either patrons are responsible with cleaning up after themselves or the employees come by and clean.  

--There was a period of time when I was the only customer in the store and I witnessed a small bit of interaction between (presumably) the manager and the employees and he seemed like he genuinely cared about them and such.  It's a good feeling for an observer!
author: Eva L.

description: good sandwich spot, but they did raise their prices. hard to compete with other sandwich places on taraval. i think building your own is the best option. i like their breakfast sandwiches a lot but they got pricier.
author: Derek M.

description: Order pick up almost every day because I work right up the block. They're the best sandwiches I've ever had.
author: Michelle K.

description: Overhyped!! Hot pastrami lacking pastrami!!! Not worth $8!  I was so looking forward to having this so close to my work
author: Alice Y.

description: First time here, love the service nice people, more importantly the sandwich are off the hook. I tried Chicken Pesto and Ami-Cado and I have to say these are the best I ever had. Looking forward to try their different sandwich next time.
author: Mack A.

description: This is a great family owned business that has a good menu and outstanding customer service. Sandwiches are yummy! The Veggie sandwich is my favorite and I can say it's the best veggie sandwich in the city.
author: Reccy S.

description: Sandwich was good, but nothing special. More concerned that a dog was inside the restaurant and the staff never questioned the owner.
author: Kim E.

description: Best Sandwich Joint! Huge for it's price! Love the sauce and everything in the sandwich. Must try and check it out! I don't want to say too much because I don't want this place to get crowded, but they are doing something right!
author: NieChelle C.

description:
I wish the crab melt had real crab......or at least specify on your menu that its imitation, and not be so misleading. 



Trying tuna melt today, and it better be real tuna.
author: A W.

description: Excellent sandwiches, the owners are a very very nice family, check it out and support the locals.
author: Ena O.

description: First time in San Fran, came here and Split a tortilla chicken salad and ultimate club sandwich with my friend. Both were very delicious! Would recommend! Very filling as well
author: Irene A.

description: I like the Roast Beef Mushroom sandwich here, I prefer no veggies. It's so good I felt like I needed larger nostrils because I could barely breath I inhaled it so fast. I tried a few other sandwiches as well, the bread is nice and fresh, and they have some creative options.
author: Jason B.

description: If i could give this place 10 stars i would... I wont waste my time talking cause I'm too busy eating this bomb ass sandwhich right now...
author: Micaela M.

description: Outstanding service! Everyone working there was extremely polite. I asked for "half cheese" on a sandwich my friend and I were splitting. They wrapped it in two halves instead of one sandwich that were individually marked. Thanks guys :)
author: Arturo R.

description: Omg, I can't even believe how good  the sandwich was that I just got. Today was my first visit and I will definitely be back.
author: Sue U.

description: I came here after school one day when I was starving and craving a sandwich. I had no idea what to expect, and with so many yummy sandwich options it was hard to decide what to choose. I opted for one with turkey, their special sauce, the fixings, and some jallepino chips in it (forgot the name of the sandwich). It was messy, but so good and mouthwatering. They don't skimp on meat or anything, so it's Definately worth the value. I also got a latte with soy milk and it was really good too, I didn't need to add sugar which I normally have to do.
author: Shira S.

description: Very helpful.  Needed sandwiches to bring on a flight.  The gentleman asked when is our flight and suggested that we leave the rolls untoasted so the bread won't get hard when eat it later.  And packed the spread separately for us.  Thank you!
author: K C.

description: How fantastic this place is, I lived 3 blocks from the first location on Geary. Now I live 4 blocks from the new location. They took what was once a dark, dingy, rather unpleasant liquor store and  have transformed it into a delightful, bright cafe. The food is top notch, great quality ingredients. It's obvious they care about third product, also, if they sold Lou's sauce in a jar I'd keep it in my fridge.
author: james H.

description: Sooo happy they opened a new location closer to me! You can never go wrong with a risky business! I called in for pick up and the process was a breeze! I love how they gave big chunks of avocado too :)))
author: Michelle H.

description: When my bro in law first went here he raved about their sandwiches. He told me he just bought one and will not go back. He said the past couple of times they were super skimpy with the amount of meat they put in the sandwich. Too bad. He sent them a lot of business because the sandwiches use to be real good.
author: Nuno M.

description:
Great location, clean restaurant, tasty sandwiches. I didn't give 5 stars only because the wait for your sandwich can be a tad long. Also the sandwiches look a bit small for the price (all though by the end of eating it, I'm usually full).

Overall I recommend it!
author: Lucinda P.

description: Love the veggie sammiches here!! Fresh ingredients! great bread! Great employees!! I don't mind waiting a bit because the sandwiches aw so good! Love the spicy spread and all of the veggies were freshly prepared and the cheese was delicious and the bread was nicely toasted!
author: David M.

description:
Best sandwich spot in the city and it's really not that close. The Lou's Sauce & Jalapeño Spread are musts and make every sandwich really come together. Some of my personal favorites are the Roma Club & Spaceballs (Meatball). They're very generous with meat and veggie portions, too, so come hungry. 

Their breakfast sandwiches are the perfect weekend (or Wednesday) hangover cure, hash browns and all. They have clam chowder every day and their soups of the day are just as good. Greek Salad is so much better than you'd expect from a sandwich spot. Super convenient, extremely consistent, and perfectly priced. Staff is always warm and welcoming, it's always a pleasure stopping in for a visit.

My only beef with Lou's is that they're not open Sundays. But I guess Lou's twice a week is enough...

Call ahead during lunch time because they get busy.
author: R K.

description: Love their sandwiches very much. It's great they open another branch here so I don't need to go to Geary all the time!
author: Eric M.

description: Lou's Cafe was suggested to us.  We drove by the cafe on Geary and the line was out the door and we weren't willing to wait.  So we went looking for another place to eat and just by pure chance, drove up Taraval and saw that a new Lou's Cafe opened up there.  The sandwiches were outstanding!  I had the Turkey Cranberry.  I love how they toasted the sourdough roll and their special sauce is just incredible...lots of zest.  Parking on Taraval is much easier than their shop on Geary.  The staff was extremely efficient.  Prices are good.  Lou's Cafe will now become a regular stop for us!!
author: Nancy E.

description: This is our first visit here at Lous Cafe. I ordered the BBQ Chicken, and it was unbelievably good! The bread, the ingredients are all fresh. And Lous sauce? Simply amazing! ! My wife and I drove all the way here from SoMa and it was worth the drive. We will definitely be back!! Come and check this place out!!
author: eric a.

description: The crab melt was fabulous! So many options to choose from. I will be back to try more undoubtedly. Great pricing and timely production.
author: Charles C.

description: Thank you Lou's for opening a shop near us! Every sandwich is so tasty here! Lots of attention to detail and incredibly fresh ingredients. The owner, Lou's son, is so friendly and the prices are very good for the quality and size. Rock on, Lou and son!
author: Les L.

description: I had the Pesto Chicken Sandwich and was very satisfied. The bread was perfectly toasted, it wasn't too hard or too soft. The pesto spread was not over powering or too salty like most places. The combination between the toasted buttery bread, moist chicken and the spread was amazing!  I called for pick-up and the service from start to finish was great. I will definitely be back. :P
author: Linh D.

description: I'm really glad Lou's is now south of the park and closer to home. My favorites are the AmiCado (with turkey instead of salami) and the Roma's Club. The sandwiches are just as good as at the Geary location, which means you should get there early to avoid a line. They aren't the speediest sandwich makers in the city, but sammies this good are worth the wait.
author: Aaron P.

description: Favorite sandwich spot! They have so many sandwiches to choose from as well as a soup of the day which is always top notch Great food and great service! 5 stars all day!
author: Brandon M.

description: From the first time I ordered a sandwich here, I realized this is the number 1 sandwich place. Their clam chowder is great too. They have a lot of items on the menu, and I'd like to try them all, but the basic roast beef sandwich is so good it's hard not to order it.
author: Mike M.

description:
A great gourmet sandwich shop located in the Parkside district.  Meat ingredients are all fresh and tasty. A vast menu selection including fresh salads and breakfast sammies.  The breakfast sammies got me sold with the hash browns inside.
Well worth the price, in the $8-$10 range.  

Service is fast and friendly.  My order is always ready in 10 minutes.
author: J M.

description: One of my favorite sandwich spots in all of SF! The place has a great menu and the ordering process is simple and quick. I ordered the hot pastrami and really only needed half. However, I inhaled the whole order and wished I had more. They also have quality chips and sodas.
author: Dan L.

description: The sandwiches are pretty good here. My boyfriend ordered his sandwich on the sourdough roll and he said it was really dry and lacked sauce even though we ordered the sandwich with "everything on it" which comes with special sauce and jalapeño spread AND we added pesto aioli. He said the sandwich was really dry and almost inedible because of the amount of bread. My sandwich was on Dutch crunch and I didn't seem to have any problems as it was pretty tasty but definitely had noticeably less bread than my boyfriend's sandwich. The sandwiches were okay but there are definitely better places in the area to pick up a solid sandwich (like the Submarine Center in West Portal). The location on Taraval is definitely roomier than the one on Geary and it's easier to find parking but the service here isn't that great.... I came in and ordered a whole bunch of food (4 sandwiches, 2 soups, a bunch of drinks, chips, salad, and coffee) and spent a good amount of money and I ended up leaving without half the items I paid for! After requesting a paper receipt on the iPad they have for check out, I didn't receive a receipt... I went and had a seat to wait for my items. About 15 mins later my sandwiches were ready and they called my name to pick up my order. Now, I understand it is my responsibility to check and make sure that I receive all the items I ordered, but after waiting for 15 minutes it slipped my mind and to be honest when they call your name for an order and hand you a few bags, you expect them to be handing you your entire order... Right?! Anyway, we left with only the sandwiches, salad, and the drinks I had already put in my bag. Only after driving home and stepping outside into the cold did I realize that I WASN'T HOLDING A HOT COFFEE! I called the shop to let them know I was coming back for the coffee that I had forgotten and they were very nice about it and told me they would make it right away. Luckily I only live 10 blocks away so it wasn't the end of the world. After driving back to the store, and waiting for my coffee I realized... HEY I DIDN'T GET MY SOUPS! I informed the girl who took my order and she seemed very confused about the situation. They reprinted my receipt only to tell me that they had only charged me for one soup! Overall it was a pretty big headache and not exactly what I would call exceptional customer service.... Like I said before I know I should have noticed the missing items but I mean, shouldn't they have given me my complete order....? So 4 stars for the food because all of our "design your own" sandwiches were made just as we ordered them but weren't necessarily the tastiest and the soup of the day (chicken noodle) was absolutely delicious but the service gets a solid 2 stars because.... Really? This was my first time at this location so I'll give them another try. Next time I'll definitely be asking them to read back my order, and I'll be verifying my entire order before I leave.
author: Anastasia G.

description: Lou's has good sandwiches.  I have tried them on several occasions and each time they have not disappoint.  One day they were closed and we had to go down the block to another sandwich shop.  The dutch crunch bread at Lou's is not quite as good as the one down the block.  But Lou's prices are a little better than down the street.  I've tried 4 different sandwiches at Lou's and all were good.
author: Em D.

description: While on the run at my job, I happened to be on Taraval St looking for a quick on the go bite.  Walked into Lou's and asked them to give me the easiest no hassle sandwich that I could eat on the road and it was the roast beef -- absolutely delicious sandwich.  (And I'm not usually a big sandwich eater).  But these guys clearly know their stuff.  The jalapeno spread was utterly magical.  Far exceeded my expectations.  If my work brings me back to the area, Lou's café is a treat worth looking forward to.
author: Linda B.

description: Yep.  Delivers.  Its kinda disappointing, because I had my place for sandwiches already (a liquor store down the way a bit) and while i like to try new things, I also like to have a go-to in any give category.   Well, that said....after 3 bites of my sandwich, this is the outer sunset go to.   Should be yours too.   Fantastic.
author: Johnny C.

description: Flamin' HOT 5 stars! Why? I don't have to tell you... Its because I don't want it to get crowded... you must see and check it for yourself! It's the BEST OF THE BEST Sandwich place in my Spot!!! Crew's are friendly and very neat to spend your time while you savoring your fav sandwich! It's about that time my friend... I know your Hungry... by the way, Your welcome!
author: Isagani c.

description: What a welcome addition to Taraval St!  I love this place and have been here a ton of times since they opened.  It is sparkling clean (a nice change from so many of the other places on Taraval), the owner and workers are really nice, and the sandwiches are fantastic.  I was skeptical about getting both of the sauces but definitely go for it!  The breakfast sandwiches and the salads are also really good.  They also offer free wifi and plugs at every seat in case you need to get a little work done while you eat.  They also have reasonable priced kid's sandwiches, which is a nice plus.  Highly recommended.
author: Jessica R.

description: I had the turkey cranberry it was really good. Owner was a nice guy too went to the same high school as him. I will come back for sure the sandwich was better than ike's place and roxie's.
author: Bron G.

description: I hate to give you 3 stars, Lou's.  You are, usually, my favorite sandwich in the city.  I like you more then Ike's.  But your Geary location is better.  Today, my sandwich was subpar.  And this wasn't the first time.  It's too saucy so it leaks through the bread, paper and paper bag, the veggies are piled in one place, not spread out through the sandwich and the bread wasn't toasted which is strange because I see you put it in the toaster/oven thing.  Is it just not on?  This has happened before so I ask for it EXTRA toasted.  No dice.  Still like it was just taken out of the store bought package.  My dining partners sandwich wasn't toasted either.  Maybe because it was Dutch Crunch?  I don't have this problem at the Geary location.  Perfect every time.  And this bums me out because I live near the Taraval location.  I want this to be better because I truly do love your sandwiches (when the bread isn't soggy and is actually toasted).  Lou's, I hope you read this and take it into consideration because I want to give you my money but not if I keep getting mediocre sandwiches.
author: Courtney G.
